Your donation entitles your name to be signed to one of the checks (or a number of other perks). 









We are a group of volunteers affiliated with Lawrence Lessig's superPAC MAYDAY (http://mayday.us). 


Zain Burghed - Co-organizer - The "idea guy" - I've volunteered with Mayday for about 6 months now. I started by donating to the super pac, and later I lobbied my senators to support the Fair Elections Now Act (FENA). It turns out our Washington State senators are staunchly opposed to fair elections. I came up with the idea of big fake blank checks for congress. I'm utilizing Mayday's volunteer network and the networks of sister organizations to make sure we have enough people to deliver these big fake blank checks to Congress, telling them that big money in politics is NOT OKAY! I know my picture is silly. It happened at a museum :) p.s. The fight for a proper democracy doesn't stop with politics. I'm creating a new economic democracy nonprofit startup (work in progress) where you choose how the economy moves forward with one equal vote. 





Brady Watson - Co-organizer - I've been involved with MAYDAY for about a year now.  It all started with a donation and I've taken on a larger volunteer role from there.  I believe campaign finance reform is the single most important issue facing our country today and working with MAYDAY is one way I've found to fight for reform.  I'm a videographer by trade but I've worked on a variety of projects for MAYDAY.  I think the big check idea is AWESOME because it symbolizes the corrupting power of money in politics in a funny yet compelling way.  Let's make it happen!



Daniel LaMagna - Co-Organizer - I got involved volunteering with MAYDAY after I heard Larry Lessig's TED talk on money in Washington. I believe corruption in politics is an issue that is bad for all Americans, regardless of their background, income level or political views. As the campaign's DC-local "boots on the ground," I'm helping Zain organize this campaign because it's a great way to raise awareness and send a message to Congress that their vote should not be for sale. 


   
 Simply, our featured perk is we will sign your name to the big checks! If you give according to the perk, we will collect your full name and sign it in eloquent script on the check. We'll also send you a picture of a volunteer holding your check! 
 


We will attempt to deliver 535 big checks to Congress in Washington D.C. among the thousands already participating in Democracy Spring. We will try to deliver each blank check to the offices of every member of Congress. Whether the Capitol let's us do it or not is up to them ... however we will be attempting to register the delivery in advance with each Congressperson's office to make sure the event "plays by the books." If we are not allowed by the police to deliver the checks in person, we will send messages to each Congress Person to come out to the front lawn of the US Capitol building (a safe protest zone) to pick up their fake blank checks in exchange for supporting campaign finance reform and citizen funded elections. We will ask the Congress People or their respective staff members to take the "Equal Voice For All Pledge" in exchange for the big fake blank check. 

The pledge reads: 

“I pledge to fight for pro-democracy reform including citizen funding of elections, voting rights protections, anti-corruption measures, and a Constitutional Amendment to overturn Citizens United to ensure that Congress is free from the corrupting influence of big money in politics and solely dependent upon the People as equal citizens.”We will try to record their response in audio and/or video, delivering it to our photostream, and their reading of the pledge, to solidify your Congress Person's stance on this extremely important issue. 

p.s. if you choose the Tee Shirt perk, you could look like this (results may vary): 



Disclaimer: 
This proposed event is being organized by participants in the Democracy Spring event and volunteers operating within a reform organization. We stand in solidarity with our sister organizations and all humans fighting for this specific kind of reform. We do not represent the organizations or people we collaborate with, nor do we answer to them. We are merely working towards a common cause and happily lend our efforts and creativity towards facilitating collectively sought-after reform.  




Printing the Checks - 65%

We are partnered with a DC local small business to print the big fake checks, because we love small businesses! 
Indiegogo and payment processing fees - 10%
Let's keep the crowdfunding industry going by paying their fees to use the platform! We love Indiegogo!  
Incidental Costs - 20%
Need to buy a megaphone. Tee shirt printing fees included here. Logistics surrounding demonstration permits from the local bureaucracies in Washington DC. Will be buying plenty of ink (giant markers and paint) to sign the checks and create other signs. This will also pay for Campaign Archival efforts on the internet. 
Balanced Budget Reserves - 5%
This will be a petty-cash reserve to pay for under-estimated budget items. 





Stretch Goal #1: Feed the Volunteers - $16,000
After meeting our initial $10000 goal to print the big checks, we will endeavor to feed the volunteer check holders. If we raise $16000 total, we'll be able to buy 535 sandwiches from a local DC Sandwich shop. Which sandwich shop should we go to? Let us know in the comments! (needs to have allergy and preference options, like gluten free, vegan, carnivore, etc.) about $10 per sandwich. 
Stretch Goal #2 through #52: Big Fake Checks for State Governments - $4000 additional per state! 
If we reach our $16000 goal to print the checks and deliver them to Congress whilst feeding our volunteers, we will create stretch goals to recreate this event in every state capitol. There are state legislatures with representatives and senators, and they are lobbied heavily to vote a certain way on certain things. We are working to end our backwards campaign finance system nationwide, so for every stretch goal we accomplish, we will deliver big fake blank checks to a State Legislature, showing them all that we are NOT OKAY with big money in politics, and openly mock their system by giving them big fake blank checks. 
There are 7398 elected State Legislature officials. On average, it will take about $4000 to print big blank checks per state, one for each congressperson and senator, in addition to organization costs. This is rounded up and averaged out ... some states only have about 20 legislators, and others have over 400. For every $4000 we raise after the initial $16,000, we will recreate this event in a US state, delivering blank checks to each State Legislator telling them that we're "buying" their support of campaign finance reform and citizen funded elections. For the state-level big fake check events, we won't be budgeting for sandwiches. 
That means the final stretch goal will be $216,000, best case scenario, and we'll try to host these events in every state over the next 18 months (in order of amount of volunteers we get to sign up via the signup sheet). 


   

State Event Cost Breakdown
70% - Printing Big Fake Blank Checks for each member of a state legislature at a local small business in the state capitol
15% - Incidental costs (ink and check mounting supplies, transportation)
10% - Indiegogo fees
5% - Under-estimate reserves
If a miracle will happen, and we raise more than is enough to perform this event in all 50 states, all the excess funding will go towards bringing more democracy and self determinism to the people of the USA and the world. We will send out a survey with options on how to spend the excess funds we raise to keep things democratic.



The big blank checks are a signal or message to Congress saying that the people recognize: 


Congressional services such as votes and bill cosponsorship are "for sale;" 
The more money a corporation or cause has, the more influence they can buy; 

MONEY IS NOT FREE SPEECH AND CORPORATIONS ARE NOT PEOPLE!;

WE ARE NOT OKAY WITH BIG MONEY IN POLITICS!; and 

The people would like to "buy" congressional influence by giving these big fake blank checks to Congress People. 

This campaign and the cause we're fighting for is about freedom and self-determinism. We choose to fight for an equal voice for all Americans within our chosen representative government. We believe that the amount of money someone has should not entitle them to more influence within that system than any other person. Our current system is severely out-dated. The most important first step towards fixing it is to completely restructure our campaign finance system to allow only publically funded elections. This prevents the undue influence of big money in politics, and provides for a system that is more closely merit-based - where the candidate most deserving for the office cannot be forced out of an election because they are unable to outspend their competition. 
 
Perhaps a subtle version of this fake-check message to Congress would be that if they don't get on board with Campaign Finance Reform and Citizen Funded Elections NOW, we'll be searching for and writing real checks to competitors for their seats in the next round of elections - which is one of Mayday's implicit goals. 
   

 

Our biggest challenge will be to source volunteers to deliver the big fake blank checks to state legislatures for our stretch goals. We already have volunteers sourced for the DC event because we are participating in Democracy Spring. A bigger overall challenge would be the fact that this severely important issue will not and cannot change overnight. We are only hoping to contribute to the whole of change, as a mere part. Our biggest goal is to raise awareness, not just with the electorate, but also to show those in power that the people are very concerned with the system as it stands. 
Sign up in your state to deliver blank checks to congress here (fun guaranteed): 
http://goo.gl/forms/OPF4SxPa7H
   

Raise your fist in the air and stand up for campaign finance reform and citizen funded elections. Fund this campaign and send the message with big fake checks! 
Sign up for Democracy Spring! 
Sign up in your state for the state events if we meet our stretch goals! 


 

Share this campaign with your friends. If you think sending Congress a serious ironic message in the form of a big fake blank check is a good idea, help us out by donating and telling your friends about us! 
Use the Indiegogo share tools! This is a good cause and it deserves your support!

story:
//CAMPAÑA PEDALAXIA//

//PEDALAXY CAMPAIGN//

Casa Naranja es un espacio okupado que se ubica en Tlalnepantla de Baz, municipio localizado al norte del Estado de México, México. Como centro social muchas y diversas personas hemos trabajado desde hace 9 años con diferentes actividades políticas y culturales, varias de ellas dirigidas a la gente del barrio.

Nos hemos juntado con DOOMSDAY BICI CLUB el cual es un colectivo de personas que difunden el uso político de la bicicleta no sólo como medio de transporte sino como un medio de diversión y juego crítico ante el sistema de consumo y dominación y los estereotipos que rodean al mundo ciclista.

Casa Naranja is a squatted space located in Tlalnepantla de Baz, a town in the north of the State of México, México. For the last 9 years it has served as social center in which we have worked with many people on different political and cultural activities, many of them aimed at people in the same neighborhood. 

We have partnered with DOOMSDAY BIKE CLUB which is a group of cool dudes and dudettes who spread the political use of the bicycle not only as transportation but as a means of fun and critical game against the system of consumption, domination and stereotypes surrounding the cycling world.

En este andar juntxs queremos construir PEDALAXIA, un Bici Taller comunitario autogestivo que responda realmente a las necesidades de transporte de nuestra colonia y las colonias cercanas. Deseamos que sea un espacio de aprendizaje e intercambio de conocimientos, de encuentro entre personas que se sientan identificadas con la visión y misión del proyecto, que los barrios se apropien del espacio de acuerdo a sus necesidades y que sea un lugar en donde a través de talleres y otros medios podamos crear lazos comunitarios, desarrollar nuestras autonomías y fortalecer las acciones que se basan en la idea hazlo tu mismx.

We want to build PEDALAXY, a self-managed bike community workshop that really meets the transportation needs of our neighborhood and nearby hoods. We desire it to be a space for learning and knowledge sharing, where people that identifies with the vision and mission of the project can meet, that the neighbors appropriate the space as needed, and where through workshops and other means we can create community ties, develop and strengthen our autonomous actions based on the idea of do it yourself.

Además de aprender e intercambiar queremos incitar a que las personas busquemos nuevas formas de relacionarnos con y entre nosotrxs, con y en nuestros espacios y entornos para que juntxs investiguemos, implementemos, experimentemos, reproduzcamos e innovemos otras maneras de usar la bicicleta, incluso en un futuro compartir los saberes sobre las tecnologías apropiadas con bicicletas tal como son las bicimáquinas.

 Moreover of learning and exchanging skills we want to encourage people to seek new ways of relating within and with themselves, with and within our spaces and environments, so that together we can investigate, implement, experience, reproduce and innovate other ways to use the bicycle. Even in the future, share the knowledge about appropriate technologies with recycled bicycles just like what bike machines are. 

Hemos visto que entre las diversas problemáticas que existen en la colonia, una de las más representativas son las relacionadas con el transporte y la movilidad de los habitantes, pues los precios del transporte público son muy elevados, sumándose a esto su ineficiencia y lo deficiente del servicio. Mucha de la gente viaja en bicicletas inseguras o en mal estado, lo cual implica más desgaste físico, más desgaste de la bici y por lo tanto un gasto económico mayor en cambiar las piezas afectadas. Por otro lado, adquirir una bicicleta nueva es un privilegio al cual pocos podemos acceder.

We have seen that among the various problems that exist in the neighborhood, one of the most representative is the one related to transportation and mobility of people, as prices of public transportation are very high, adding to this inefficiency and a poor service. Many people travel on unsafe bicycles or in poor condition, which implies more physical wear, more wear on the bike and therefore greater economic spending on changing the affected parts. On the other hand, obtaining a new bike is a privilege that few can afford.

Por todo lo anterior hemos decidido acondicionar el pequeño taller en Casa Naranja, el cual es austero y no contamos con suficiente herramienta para poder trabajar más fuerte y tener un impacto mayor ante la situación de la que hablamos antes, por lo tanto necesitamos el apoyo diverso de ustedes las personas, colectivos, organizaciones y todo aquel que se sienta identificadx con este nuevo proyecto!

Faced with this situation we decided to improve the small workshop in Casa Naranja, which is austere and does not have enough tools to work harder and have a greater impact on the situation we talked about before, in this way we need your diverse support, as individuals, groups, organizations and all who can identify with this new project! 

LO QUE NECESITAMOS

Nuestro objetivo es que PEDALAXIA sea para 2016 un taller comunitario realmente autogestivo, por eso estamos haciendo un llamado solidario para obtener fondos monetarios con los que podremos rehabilitar el actual taller lo que implica comprar láminas para el techo y compartimentos adecuados para organizar refacciones, accesorios y herramientas.

Con estos fondos también podremos adquirir más bicicletas, las herramientas  y maquinaria adecuadas para su reparación y mantenimiento, así como para  herrería y carpintería,  esto para la construcción de bicimáquinas y demás modificaciones.

WHAT WE NEED

Our goal is that PEDALAXY will be in 2016 a truly self-managed community workshop, so we are calling out for monetary fund that can rehabilitate the current workshop which involves buying metal sheets for proper roof and compartments to organize bike parts, accessories and tools. 

With these funds we can also acquire more bicycles, suitable tools and machinery  for their repair and maintenance as well as blacksmithing and carpentry for building the bike machines and other modifications.

LOS FONDOS SE DISTRIBUIRAN DE LA SIGUIENTE FORMA:

$ 2500. usd. : Incluye herramientas especiales para bicicleta, herramientas complementarias (taladro, esmeril, etc.) planta de soldar y compresor de aire.

$1500. usd. : Rehabilitación física del techo del taller que incluye láminas metálicas, perfiles de acero, etc.

$1000. usd. : Insumos extras para mantenimiento de las bicicletas, refacciones  y recompensas.

En el caso de que se junte más dinero en esta campaña, lo usaríamos para mas juegos de herramientas, los cuales podrán ser de muchísima utilidad durante los talleres de mecánica de bicicletas.

THE FUND WILL BE DISTRIBUTED AS FOLLOWS:

$ 2500 usd. : It includes tools especially for bikes, complementary tools (drill, grinder, etc.) welding machine, air compressor.

$ 1500 usd. : Physical rehabilitation for the workshop roof that includes foils, steel sections, etc.

$ 1000 usd. : Extra supplies for bike maintenance (oil, patches, etc.) spare parts and rewards.

In the event that more money comes together in this campaign, we would use it for more toolkits, which can be extremely useful for the bicycles mechanics workshop teachings.

LO QUE OBTIENES

La Campaña PEDALAXIA Bici Taller Comunitario agradece tus contribuciones con recompensas, aunque de algún modo simbólicas están especialmente diseñadas para ti; en la sección de Recompensas te explicamos, qué recibes a cambio de tu contribución. Gracias por apoyarnos.

WHAT YOU GET

This PEDALAXY Campaign thanks your contributions with rewards, although they are symbolic they are designed especially for you; On the rewards section we explain what you receive in exchange for your contribution. Thank you for supporting us.

EL IMPACTO

El barrio en el cual estamos ubicados no tiene un taller o tienda de bicicletas cerca, el más próximo se localiza en el centro de Tlalnepantla que queda a 7 km de distancia. Estamos seguros que al tener un taller como Pedalaxia para los barrios locales, será altamente útil y tendrá un impacto bueno e importante para la comunidad. Pensamos que será trascendente no sólo por su utilidad sino por ser también un espacio que reivindique el papel social y político de la bicicleta no sólo como un medio de transporte apropiado sino también como una herramienta para la construcción de comunidad, autonomía y autogestión en todos los sentidos.

THE IMPACT

The neighborhood in which we are situated does not have a workshop or bicycle shop nearby, the closest is located in the center of Tlalnepantla which is 7 km away. We are sure that having a workshop as Pedalaxia will be highly useful to the local neighborhoods and will have a good and an important impact on the community. We believe this bike workshop will be transcendent not only for its practicality but will also be a place that claims the social and political role of the bicycle as a proper means of transportation and also as a tool for the construction of autonomy and self-management in all senses.

OTRAS FORMAS EN LAS QUE PUEDES APOYAR

Sabemos que no todos pueden colaborar de forma monetaria, sin embargo, nos sentiremos muy agradecidos si puedes apoyarnos donando herramientas, refacciones de bici, materiales para el espacio físico y sobre todo difundiendo esta propuesta.

Gracias y Buena rodada para todxs!

Bike!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT

We know that not everyone can collaborate in monetary form, however, we will be very grateful if you can support us by donating tools, spare bike parts, materials for  the space and especially spreading out this proposal.

Thank you and have a great ride!

Bike!

story:
Veteran Field Manual: Civilian Life 1-1


Help reduce veteran suicide, eliminate negative stigmas, empower our great military generations, and bridge the gap of confusion back to civilian life. Veterans are never alone! 

Our service members receive years of training to become combat efficient...but they receive little to no guidance about transitioning back to civilian society following their service.

Individuals that volunteer into a combative occupation on behalf of a nation's rights have the highest suicide rates among the American population.
We lose an average of 22 veterans a day to suicide

We're looking to change that.


Whether it is pre-ordering a copy for a friend or loved one, or donating to support our veterans, every dollar makes a difference in bringing this resource to life and joining the fight to save the lives of veterans.


Meet the Author  

Good day, my name is Todd M. Kuikka. Thank you for taking time to consider the difficulty facing thousands of veterans and families during the reintegration back to civilian life. 

As a 14-year veteran, I struggled with life after service to my country as an Explosive Ordnance Disposal Team Leader. I served multiple combat tours and successfully completed countless missions, overcame losses, and shared successes with my team. 

But the hardest battle I faced was returning "home" and finding peace with my past and purpose in my future. I felt alone and yearned for the team I overcame so much with. 

I was seeing my brothers and sisters in arms returning from hell and killing themselves and I was on the verge myself. I was scared! There had to be a better option that honors the service of these scarred warriors. 

I started speaking with other vets and identifying healthy strategies on my civilian journey. Together with my veteran community and family, I found ways to utilize the core values that Uncle Sam bestowed in me to successfully navigate the trail back home to civilian life. 

As a former combat team leader, I will not allow others to flail and fall if I can offer them support. We are morally obligated to keeping our military teams safe after their service. This book helps provide a safe path for veterans reintegrating into civilian life. I believe this opportunity could save the lives of our struggling brothers and sisters in arms. Veterans are never alone.  


Mission Planning

This project is the result of documenting a lot of hardship and finding ways to implement veteran mentality into coping and managing the stresses of reintegration. Starting as a journal and formatted to fit group discussion, it is now intended as a non-clinical  and peer mentoring approach to life after military service. It has a proven record as a successful family and group discussion guide. 

This tool is offered from the perspective of veterans and their families. We believe this book will offer the hope and navigation skills needed to alleviate many of the negative social and legal consequences experienced when military standards run into the civilian expectations. It discusses many of the complications and misconceptions held by veteran communities and our civilian counterparts.
Decriminalization of veteran behavior can reduce social stigmas and maintain the dignity and honor that veterans found in their service.

The Mission Objective
We are trying to attain our goal by Veterans Day 2015. Our project target is $7,500.00. This will cover the production cost for 1,000 books, e-services, distribution, promotional materials, and campaign management through this site. If our goal is not fully attained, we will utilize the available funding to produce what we can to move the project forward. With such a noble cause as this, we will not stop. 
Once funding is released for this campaign, books can take up to three months to produce and distribute, making a projected availability of February 2016. Additionally, any funding made over our target will generate a 20% donation to American veterans organizations and continued project development, promotions, and availability.  


Contributions to this campaign will make available a valuable weapon to combat reintegration issues for our military and veteran community. All proceeds will be utilized for the production and distribution of Veteran Field Manual: Civilian Life 1-1 as outline above. Believe--me if writing and reaching others was a lucrative business, I would not be asking for your help!

Your decision to support and contribute to the success of this project will significantly impact the success of our veteran community during reintegration back to civilian life. Loon House Designs & Concepts™is a veteran owned and operated design and art studio that highlights the therapeutic value of art in healing and coping with wounds of war. Some of their materials are being used to promote this campaign. 

With your support, you can receive limited edition printed materials and the pride of knowing that you have an influence on easing veterans' reintegration burdens in your communities. You can also show your pride as a veteran community supporter with "Veterans Are Never Alone, in the Loon House" bumper stickers and "Why Stress" T-shirts. 

   

Recon

During the process of writing this manuscript, there was no quantifiable way to document all of the time, efforts, and resources that went into my findings. My personal struggles encouraged my interest. I found that I was not alone. Countless hours were spent speaking with representatives from all attainable generation and demographic backgrounds of veterans and their families. Many contacts were made with noted sociologists, mental health professionals, care providers, legal authorities, and government officials. This offered both sides of the story--from the veteran's perspective and the community's perceptions. The personal experiences and supportive alliances found in the investigations give great hope to those that struggle with mental health, physical issues, and chemical dependency following combat. Trust is recovered in families that seem broken. As I identify in the writing "nothing is irrecoverable."    

Beaver's Pond Press is the publisher that was chosen for this project. The expert guidance and undying support from their veteran staff and family has been valued by me, as a first time published author. Not only have they guided me through my ignorance, but they believe in this project and lowered the cost to the minimum possible to get the resource to our veterans. They are helping maintain a product purely made in the U.S.A.  

The manuscript is ready for production...but we need your help to produce this valuable resource and get it to our veteran community. 

Please utilize the contribution options for your pledge to this fight. Also, don't forget to share and like the campaign so we can promote the heck out of it. Lastly, thank you to Indiegogo for hosting this campaign, we are encouraged by this easy to navigate venue and we are grateful for the opportunity to reach, support, and help our veteran community. Don't forget to like and share Indiegogo.

Help reduce veteran suicide, eliminate negative stigmas, empower our great military generations, and bridge the gap of confusion back to civilian life. Veterans are never alone! 


Our service members receive years of training to become combat efficient...but they receive little to no guidance about transitioning back to civilian society following their service.
Individuals that volunteer into a combative occupation on behalf of a nation's rights have the highest suicide rates among the American population.
We lose an average of 22 veterans a day to suicide

story:
Author Bio:

     Rem's passion for fantastic worlds was a big part of her life since she was old enough to tell the difference between the villain and the hero. Stories enchanted and allowed her to see the world in a different way. They brought light over loneliness, bringing a new friend with every page she turned. Her love for travelling through different characters helped her battle life's own demons by sending them into oblivion, using a sword called hope. Her eyes started to see the magic in everything around her and one day her soul screamed for a story that needed to be told. That's how "Above the Clouds" was born. By telling the story of Stratus, the author explores the struggle of escaping from a society that doesn't give you the freedom to be yourself. 

Founder of the company Creartscape Teh S.R.L., Rem is also passionate about video games. The game inspired from the novel, Above the Clouds, won people's choice awards at the Indie Prize Competition, hosted by Casual Connect in San Francisco, 2015. 

                                                         


What's the book about?


     For ages, the creatures dwelling in the realm of Celestiopia were shaped to be strong and honorable. Small in size, possessing extraordinary abilities, they were charged from birth with the duty to protect and guide the human world. When their homeland was shattered, the characters found themselves questioning everything they had been taught, in search of the truth behind what had happened.


 


     Above the clouds is a fantasy novel written in an enchanting way, allowing readers to embark on a life-changing journey along with the main character. This story takes place in the land of Celestiopia, located above the clouds, invisible to the human eye. This realm was the home of beings with extraordinary powers. The story is centered around Stratus, a lonely, grumpy creature, who starts to question everything he had been taught. Pushed by a desire to be better and do more for the community, he decides to do whatever it takes to change his destiny. The struggles he faces along with the encounters he has, allow the character to evolve from a troubled introvert into a fearless leader. One of the themes of the novel is the constant chase for the ideal feeling of happiness, illustrated throughout the book as something an individual craves and needs in order to have a functional life. By telling the story of Stratus, I'm  telling the story of every person whom is trying to belong or is struggling to escape from a society that doesn't give them the freedom to be themselves.

                                                 


Why Crowdfund?

The funds I'm raising will be used to cover the costs of fully illustrating and printing the book. The art and design  is very pricy and I have already personally invested in the project because I believe in it so much. My goal is to add at least 30 new high quality illustrations to the book. The printing costs include: paper, layout, gluing inserts, hard cover.  Surpassing the goal means that more people will have access to the book, because we can print more copies and do community outreach! 
  • Though this is a flexible-funding campaign, I will be printing the book regardless of how much I raise, but the number of illustrations and the size of the order will be determined by the success of the campaign.
Example of printed photo illustrations:

                                          



         


The Impact

As a pshychology major, I studied children's psychology and I always wanted to find a way to get involved in children's positive development, stimulate their creativity at a young age and help parents bond with their children more.

Parents and teachers have long known that a child's brain can soak up information like a sponge. Our children take in everything they see and store it in their subconscious, creating their personality. What we expose them to is very important. The way each child perceives and senses the world is unique. While the body and mind constantly grow, perceptions also change. Children's sense of the material world and of the space around it also changes.
Publishing a book like this gives me the opportunity to touch people and hopefully raise awareness that creativity in a child is very important and should be nourished at a young age. 


How reading to your child helps his development:

1 - Stories can help children cope with many feelings and problems and they learn things about the world just by enjoying the story.

2. Reading books to children at bedtime is a wonderful bonding experience that nourishes emotional development. Parents can also help the child relate the incidents in the story to real events in their lives.

3 - Reading books regularly stimulates children’s imagination and fosters natural curiosity. Children quickly learn to visualize the scenarios mentioned in the stories by reading the text alone. This type of development works even better if a parent assists in the process. 

4 - Stories promote the devlopment of empathy. Fiction is a powerful vehicle for the development of empathy because the listeners (readers) automatically identify with one or more of the story's characters. In identifying, the listener experiences vicariously the sorrows, joys, triumphs, defeats and ethical conflicts of the protagonist - and maybe those of the antagonist, too.

    


Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring! If you are excited about this or know someone who might be, help support by sharing this campaign with your friends on social media. 

Sometimes it's hard to figure out the right way to thank someone, especially when what they did for you is priceless. Success is the fruit of personal effort plus support and encouragement from people like you. Thank you for giving me a shoulder when I could not support myself.

story:
About the Play

This is a play about mothers and daughters, female strength and family. It is a play about survival and the subsequent scars that survival can inflict.

The Chinese say that, "raising a daughter is like throwing a bowl of water out the door," or "raising a pig is more beneficial than raising a daughter.”

The playwright Lucy Chau Lai-Tuen, herself a transracial adoptee, often used to wonder why.  Why had she been abandoned on the streets of Kowloon as a baby, only a few days old? Was it because she was a girl? Was it because her parents were too poor to look after yet another hungry mouth?

These are the questions that sparked the inspiration for Conversations With My Unknown Mother. Ultimately asking all of us what would we do if after all this time you came face to face with your birthmother?

What would you say? How would you feel?
Would it bring "closure" or would it leave more questions unanswered?


What's Needed & What You Get
How does your contribution help?

The money raised from this campaign (£1,500) forms part of the overall £12,000 Arts Council Grant for the Arts application. 

Each pound from your generous donation will be stretched, and all expenditures will be carefully recorded for transparency. The funds breakdown is as follows: 

  • One weeks residency at The Arcola Theatre (tbc and subject to a successful Arts Council Gfta submission)
  • Pay all fees and costs  for the development week
  • Actors fees, directors fees, producer and stage management.

Even if the campaign does not reach its goal, whatever happens your contribution will be used for this play and this play only and its further development. 


The Impact

British Theatre and the arts will continue to stagnate whilst at the same time people crave and lobby for greater diversity.

If you're passionate about theatre, if you support diversity in the arts, if you want to see new work that challenges, that explores an alternative British experience, then the only logical thing to do is support this campaign. 

Every single penny counts! Be an active participant in Lucy's journey as she takes her work from the page to the stage.


Risks & Challenges

Life is not without risk. Everyday we open our front door and step out, we're taking a risk, but it doesn't stop us, does it? 

The arts is like any other industry sector - it's a risk. 

What are you risking? 
Thankfully only what you're willing to contribute. 

Lucy has the support and backing of some high profile industry professionals and organisations, if it doesn't work out this time round then Lucy will be trying again and again and again.

Lucy is an artist that is going places, how far and how quickly, in some sense it is up to you and how many people will support this campaign. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can financially contribute, we completely understand. 

But you can contribute to the campaign in other ways:

  • You can share this campaign amongst your networks and contacts.
  • Spread the word!
  • You could pledge in-kind support. Maybe you run a local printing firm, you could offer free printing, for a run of A5 advertising cards?
    Perhaps you run an internet radio station and can offer free online/broadcasting support by advertising the campaign?
    Perhaps you're a local business that could offer your services for free during the Development week such as complimentary food provision over at The Arcola Theatre for the actors?
  • Maybe you'd be willing to hold a bake sale or a collection tin in your business? Organise a bric-a-brac sale? 

Don't be shy drop the campaign a line with you support offers and ideas.
It would be great to hear from you.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
C'est quoi, un CRM?

Besoin de capter le signalétique de vos clients, mais aussi l'historique de vos interactions avec vos prospects? Besoin de fédérer votre équipe autour de vos processus commerciaux? Besoin de bétonner vos démarches commerciales (automatisation, approbation, escalation, etc)? Besoin de faire le lien avec vos initiatives marketing? Bingo, vous avez trouvé. C'est à cela que servent les applications CRM.

Le problème

Mais voilà... Vous êtes dirigeant de PME, et vous savez comme c'est compliqué de lever le nez du guidon. Mais vous n'avez pas le temps. Et même si vous aviez le temps de chercher un CRM pour votre PME, vous ne sauriez pas par où commencer.

Votre entreprise galère donc encore et toujours avec des outils d'une autre époque. Excel et Outlook règnent en maître. Peut-être même utilisez-vous encore une application Access ou Filemaker qui tourne dans un coin... C'est la soupe aux données, c'est la foire aux fichiers et pourtant quand on cherche une info, on ne la trouve pas, ou alors elle est périmée, ou alors elle est en double et les doublons se contredisent...

N'importe quelle PME (et la vôtre aussi) a besoin de se structurer pour pouvoir se développer avec efficacité et surtout avec flexibilité. Aujourd'hui, plus besoin de faire appel aux informaticiens pour organiser votre entreprise: les outils sont largement disponibles sur le web, ils sont peu onéreux et ils en font un max! Ils offrent aux PME une puissance de feu à peine imaginable il y a quelques années encore.

Pourquoi j'ai écrit ce livre

Un bon livre peut faire des miracles. Pour moi, un livre "business" ne doit pas seulement faire réfléchir, il doit aussi donner des clés et un plan pour passer à l'action. L'action, en ce qui vous concerne, c'est maintenant de trouver le meilleur CRM possible et de le déployer avec succès dans votre PME. Ce livre est là pour vous y aider.

Le contenu du livre

Tout ce qu'il faut savoir pour vous lancer dans ce projet, et surtout pour le faire aboutir:

  • analyser les CRM du marché
  • savoir quel CRM choisir
  • définir le rôle de votre CRM dans votre transformation digitale
  • gérer la relation avec l'éditeur et avec les consultants
  • comment formaliser votre fonds de commerce digital
  • comment impliquer votre équipe et lui faire adopter le bébé
  • comment profiter de l'occasion pour passer en mode agile
  • comment revisiter vos processus et automatiser un maximum
  • comment améliorer la collaboration et la communication interne
  • comment personnaliser votre marketing avec les données de votre CRM
  • comment aider vos collabrateurs au jour le jour
  • comment mieux servir vos clients

Comment cela va-t-il vous aider

J'ai mis ma casquette de patron de PME et j'ai fait un inventaire précis, simple, structuré des étapes et des jalons qui doivent baliser votre projet CRM. Mon objectif est de vous faire gagner un maximum de temps. Avec ce livre, en me basant sur mon expérience CRM auprès d'une centaine d'entreprises, je vous aide à vous poser les bonnes questions et à faire les choses dans le bon ordre, sans vous éparpiller.

Le livre n'est pas un mode d'emploi ou un manuel, mais c'est plutôt un cheminement qui commence par une prise de conscience des enjeux: "qu'est-ce qui se passe si je ne bouge pas?". Il va ensuite vous aider à faire l'état des lieux de vos données et de vos processus, avec des outils simples et ludiques (des QCM, des tests, des jeux de rôles et des animations à faire en équipe). Vous allez apprendre à rassembler vos collaborateurs autour du projet, pour avancer de façon décomplexée et efficace, sans prise de tête. Il aborde des questions essentielles comme le choix de la plateforme, la motivation du staff, l'amélioration continue des données, l'automatisation marketing, etc.

J'ai voulu en faire un livre très pratico-pratique, mais inspirant et éclairant également.


Pourquoi cette campagne?

La rédaction du livre est terminée. Reste à peaufiner la copie, et des confrères (que je remercie au passage) m'aident actuellement avec la relecture du manuscrit. La dernière étape sera alors la mise en page définitive et l'impression d'un premier tirage à 1000 exemplaires. Le but de cette campagne est tout simple: pouvoir lancer ce premier tirage et être dans les librairies en janvier 2016.

En participant à cette campagne, vous recevrez votre exemplaire du livre bien avant tout le monde. Mais en plus, vous en faites profiter d'autres: en fonction de la contrepartie choisie, vous recevez aussi un (ou plusieurs) exemplaire(s) pour les amis de votre choix, avec un petit mot leur disant que c'est vous qui leur offrez le livre.

Qui je suis

Je suis consultant CRM & ERP depuis ... pas mal d'années. J'ai déployé mon tout premier CRM chez mon premier employeur en 1995, et je n'ai jamais cessé d'en utiliser pendant tout mon parcours professionnel. Depuis 2013 j'aide des PME et des associations à déployer ces outils et à tirer profit de leur transformation digitale.

Le web me passionne depuis toujours, notamment parce qu'il permet à une PME de se faire passer pour plus grande qu'elle n'est. Les applis web évoluent à une vitesse impressionnante. Pour suivre cela, il faut être très attaché à son indépendance: j'ai eu l'occasion de travailler avec la plupart des plateformes du marché (par exemple Akti, Batchbook, Bitrix, Capsule, Dolibarr, Dynamics, Efficy, Insightly, Nimble, Nutshell, Odoo, Openbravo, Oracle CX, Podio, Salesforce, Selligent, SugarCRM, Teamleader, vtiger, Zoho, Zurmo...) mais aussi avec des outils de marketing automation (Eloqua, Hubspot, Infusionsoft, Marketo, Mautic, Pardot...). Cela me permet de garder une vue aussi objective que possible sur les différents outils, mais aussi d'avoir un point de vue relativement éclairé sur l'évolution du marché et sur les enjeux que cela représente pour l'utilisateur que vous êtes.

Et puis surtout, être à l'aise avec les outils, cela me permet de ne pas oublier l'essentiel: votre staff et vos clients. Ce sont eux qui font la différence. Votre CRM, c'est d'abord pour eux. Je ne l'oublie jamais, et je me plais à vous le rappeler à vous aussi ;-)

Pour en savoir plus, trouvez-moi sur LinkedIn ou sur Twitter. Ce n'est pas très difficile.  (hint: je m'appelle Olivier Caeymaex)
story_txt:
C'est quoi, un CRM?
Besoin de capter le signalétique de vos clients, mais aussi l'historique de vos interactions avec vos prospects? Besoin de fédérer votre équipe autour de vos processus commerciaux? Besoin de bétonner vos démarches commerciales (automatisation, approbation, escalation, etc)? Besoin de faire le lien avec vos initiatives marketing? Bingo, vous avez trouvé. C'est à cela que servent les applications CRM.

Le problème
Mais voilà... Vous êtes dirigeant de PME, et vous savez comme c'est compliqué de lever le nez du guidon. Mais vous n'avez pas le temps. Et même si vous aviez le temps de chercher un CRM pour votre PME, vous ne sauriez pas par où commencer.

Votre entreprise galère donc encore et toujours avec des outils d'une autre époque. Excel et Outlook règnent en maître. Peut-être même utilisez-vous encore une application Access ou Filemaker qui tourne dans un coin... C'est la soupe aux données, c'est la foire aux fichiers et pourtant quand on cherche une info, on ne la trouve pas, ou alors elle est périmée, ou alors elle est en double et les doublons se contredisent...
N'importe quelle PME (et la vôtre aussi) a besoin de se structurer pour pouvoir se développer avec efficacité et surtout avec flexibilité. Aujourd'hui, plus besoin de faire appel aux informaticiens pour organiser votre entreprise: les outils sont largement disponibles sur le web, ils sont peu onéreux et ils en font un max! Ils offrent aux PME une puissance de feu à peine imaginable il y a quelques années encore.

Pourquoi j'ai écrit ce livre
Un bon livre peut faire des miracles. Pour moi, un livre "business" ne doit pas seulement faire réfléchir, il doit aussi donner des clés et un plan pour passer à l'action. L'action, en ce qui vous concerne, c'est maintenant de trouver le meilleur CRM possible et de le déployer avec succès dans votre PME. Ce livre est là pour vous y aider.


Le contenu du livre
Tout ce qu'il faut savoir pour vous lancer dans ce projet, et surtout pour le faire aboutir:


analyser les CRM du marché
savoir quel CRM choisir
définir le rôle de votre CRM dans votre transformation digitale
gérer la relation avec l'éditeur et avec les consultants
comment formaliser votre fonds de commerce digital
comment impliquer votre équipe et lui faire adopter le bébé
comment profiter de l'occasion pour passer en mode agile
comment revisiter vos processus et automatiser un maximum
comment améliorer la collaboration et la communication interne
comment personnaliser votre marketing avec les données de votre CRM
comment aider vos collabrateurs au jour le jour
comment mieux servir vos clients

story:
Short Summary

Douglas Boyer has written in retrospect as he reviews his life’s journey. Through poetry and reflection, he has the uncanny ability to draw the reader into his world where decades of escaped emotions are relived, and dreams of a journey lost seem so far out of reach. In the darkness, the author stretches with every fiber of his being, refusing to accept the inevitable.

His writing reflects the dissatisfaction that accompanies the pain of laboring through the change of lifestyle in which you’ve become entangled. The dark habits hold you back. At the very moment when it appears that you will become overwhelmed and sucked into nothingness, hope springs eternal, and somewhere in the distance—light appears through the darkness beckons to you (Luke 1:79.)

For the first time in your frightful, miserable, lonesome, rock-bottom condition, you find yourself experiencing real freedom, real hope, and a real power of choice. What a journey. Thank God for loving us when we feel unlovable. Thank God for adopting us into His family; thank God for saving us.

Through his prose, Brother Douglas does not paint a pretty picture of himself or his former life. He keeps it real and to the point. It was painful for him to relive, and the pain is still there as you read his words The world of drug and alcohol addiction is ugly and largely misunderstood by most of the world including the Church.

Many believe addiction it is a disease; it is not. Sickle cell is a disease, and cancer is a disease. Addiction of any sort, including nicotine, is a choice. Romans 7:14-25 defines it clearly. It is powerlessness! Unless you’ve been there, you cannot academically or intellectually understand it.

Brother Douglas pours out his confession before GOD and man. He has done this openly, remorsefully, and I might add bravely. As one who has been a “prisoner sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death” (Psalms 107: 1-16).

I recommend this reading. I also commend Brother Douglas for writing it. For those living this lifestyle and want redemption through Christ, read this for hope. You are not alone. For the spouses and children of those who live with those living these lifestyles, trust that GOD surely hears your prayers.

Your donation will be applied to Douglas's account to bring this book to the public.

story:
The Change Series/Pockets of Time...

What if the coin in your pocket could talk? What would it say to us? Who had it before? What was it a witness to? The Pockets of Time tells the story of Americans from the 1940's to present day as coin goes from person to person and place to place. Some individuals are famous, most are people like your neighbors. It's about constant change, and yet how we are all connected in some way, even spanning time and people and events we're unaware of. It's about daily life, as well some historic events that have touched us all. Follow along @PocketsOfTime #WhatWouldYourCoinSay

How I got the idea - a coin in a vending machine....

This idea started when my dad brought home a nickel from the vending machine at his workplace in 2006. The nickel was minted in 1945. The wheels in my head turned just thinking about what all has happened since then, and then where that specific coin had been. The idea was born for a series of books featuring coins from various eras and locations. The first being America from the 1940's to present day.

My vision for the story....

My vision for this historical fiction and adventure series, at least the first book is to champion American Exceptionalism, faith, redemption, breaking barriers, and displaying the bonds that tie us together in our humanity and communities. The story features several individual tales that overlap generations (of real stories and fictional ones), all finally connecting in the end via the coin. Along the way there are several side stories and adventures including several big moments in history and lives of celebrities. The coin itself is a vehicle that transports us across these American lives. My goal is to also complete a shorter children's version of the book that will feature the coin speaking as a narrator. 

Already a NaNoWriMo Winner!


The book was a winner of the National Novel Writing Month in 2013. I managed to write 62,000 words that November. Due to numerous setbacks, I'm not ready to have this story published. But I could use a little help in a few areas! My goal is to have the first book in the series ready to be published in 2016.

Be a part of the story!

  • There are four things I could use funding for. 1. Editing. 2. Historical Consulting. 3. Find a consultant who knows the ins and outs of how physical currency is exchanged - this is beyond simple transactions. 4. Promotion and Publishing.
  • There are several levels of funding listed here. You can even be a part of the story with some of the options!
  • In exchange for being a part of the story your donation will help me find a good team of people to edit and verify the historical elements of the story, as well as help in the publishing and promotion of the story.

Pockets of Time Impact

I hope this book and the future series will accomplish:
  • An interest in history.
  • Illustrate that despite differences, even deep ones, at some basic level we are connected, sometimes in ways we don't have any idea or understanding of. In light of that we should always be kind, respectful, and good to our neighbors.
  • Encourage people to dream.
  • Encourage faith and love of our fellow Americans and our country.

Challenges - Check out the video series here for the details of how I worked through these.

Making this story real and authentic while at the same time a magical adventurous journey was a challenge, but I'm confident I have achieved a great story! Here's a few of the direct challenges I encountered with the story itself, and some of the challenges of getting a completed book published. You can check out my video series on the creative challenges here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4v4vwAt84t5I2SsQoRNBeHCDB-R152Ng

  • Creative Challenge: Physical and reasonable limitations and expectations of a coin. In theory a coin from the 1940's could have travelled through the hands of millions of people. In theory it could have just sat in one place for 70+ years as well. There's no practical way to write this story with having that many physical transactions between that many individuals - at least not in a way that wouldn't be tiresome, boring, or way too lengthy. I had to come up with creative ways for the coin to sit for various lengths of time, or for ways to fast forward. I believe I've done this fairly well, but adding a few more characters via your donations will help this process as well.
  • Creative Challenge: Balancing act between the extraordinary and the ordinary. Balancing act between big historic events and regular daily life. Balancing act between historic figures and celebrities and regular Joe and Jane like you and I. I had to find the right mix and still keep this story interesting, fun, and believable. 
  • Creative Challenge: Avoiding "Forest Gump" or similar type tale. I had this concern early on, but this naturally worked itself out in a few ways. 1. My story is simply different in style. 2. My story crosses multiple lives interconnecting, sometimes linked through past events or a common person, or just the coin itself, not solely the story of one individual impacting the lives of others. This is the tale of many impacting each other and the world around them. 
  • Creative Challenge: Historic details. What was the price of milk in 1965? When did the Denver Mint open? What was the average household income in 1955? What was the #1 song during a week in July in 1983 that might have been heard on the radio while traveling across the state of Kansas? What was a popular street for teens to hang out on in Jackson, Mississippi in the 1970's? Who was the Governor of Ohio in 1990? Who was the starting pitcher for a Cubs and Cardinals game in 1976? Some of these are easy to find, others are not. Subtle details, and these aren't necessarily in the book itself, but they are example of details I want to verify so I have an accurate historical story.
I feel I've accomplished the creative challenges myself. Now I just need some validation with some of it - the historical details for example, and some help with the editing and promotion.
  • Publication Challenge: Editing. 
  • Publication Challenge: Historical validation.
  • Publication Challenge: Monetary exchanges/habits. 

Help with "Pockets of Time!"

If you're not able to donate but like my idea here are some ways you can assist me:

  • If you have historical knowledge, maybe you can help me out, especially in the areas of decade "bread and butter" stuff and pop culture.
  • Share my project with those you think will be interested by using the Indiegogo tools.
  • Follow my progress and purchase the book when it is released!

story:
Dear friends,

You are warmly invited to participate in finishing my book project, A Soul Divided: Memoir of a Modern Emigrant. During times of fear and upheaval in our native countries, many of us have no choice but to search in foreign lands for the chance to survive . . . hopefully, prayerfully, without losing our very selves. It is a struggle many must face during times of considerable change and uncertainty. It is a struggle surmounted only when we give our all.

 

I am Maka Kverenchkiladze-Kartheiser, born in 1970 in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. I spent my early life in this Soviet Union country, until I could no longer survive the fallout of their seventy years of rule. Before I left for a life I’d never expected to have, I graduated from Tbilisi State University with a BA and an MA in Arts of Georgian Language and Literature. Inspired by my father, I wish to continue my dreams of being an author and of using my experiences and discoveries to forge bonds between different yet beautiful countries and cultures.

 A Soul Divided: Memoir of a Modern Emigrant, a story, years in the making. It is my personal journey from the European country of Georgia, my beloved homeland, to my cherished new foster country, the United States of America.

It is a story not unlike those of thousands of fellow emigrants who, like me, were and still are forced to move away from their homelands, leaving behind their lifelong friends, parents, and children . . . leaving behind a piece of their soul.

The struggle to find one’s place, one’s self, and one’s calling is universal; for emigrants, the struggle is even more to bear. We are destined to belong to two countries, and to neither. We are destined to dwell among those who fit, but not fit. We are destined to live life with a soul divided. And to live it our best.

This is a story of hope, inspiration, and strength to do what seems impossible. It takes you heart and soul into the experience of holding on to one’s identity, roots, and culture while taking in the best of one’s new culture. It leads you to make the most of each challenge and each relationship for the better future of the world.

 

I know many of you have been waiting for this book to be published. I am thankful for your constant support and encouragements throughout these years. The project has reached its most important process, that of editing and self-publishing, and this is why I am asking for your help.

You can give assistance in two ways:

  1. Donate $20 usd  or more - With this, you will receive a free copy of the book when it publishes, and you will experience the joy of knowing you helped me publish a beautiful book that I can share with the world.
  2. Please share this campaign with friends and family members who would like to experience the inside story of immigration.

With your support, this book can speak to thousands of emigrants who believe their journeys and hardships are unique, and give them courage and hope. With your support, this book can also open the eyes of those who belong to countries that allow immigration, and help them understand—from behind the eyes and within the shoes of a modern emigrant—the isolation and challenges we overcome while having to remain strong.

The book, through main character’s experiences, inspires readers from all walks of life to keep moving forward, no matter what life throws at you . . . and to persist in finding your vocation and special purpose, no matter what the circumstances may be.

The beginning of the book is here for you to read, that you may see whether this memoir speaks to your soul.

The campaign amount of $8,000 usd will go to the editor as well as partial publishing expenses. I am compelled to achieve this goal for my book and my fellow emigrants, to be their comfort, encouragement, and voice in their new foster countries.

Thank you for graciously considering donating to this project.
