Na de start wilde ik meteen weten hoe het afliep. Zeer vlot geschreven. Ik moet qua wendingen en plot aan Dan Brown denken, maar dan over een heel ander onderwerp.Roland---------
"Als alle rede is vergaan, heiligt slechts het doel dan de middelen?"Johan Bos geeft met Refugium een indringend statement af, als briljante romanschrijver en als pleitbezorger voor de ontredderde staat van onze planeet en haar supportsystemen. Op slimme en verrassende wijze bouwt hij een relevante en actuele eko-crimi, met als fundament een ingenieus fantasy-verhaal dat leest als een trein en je na de laatste pagina nog dagen lang in een onheilspellende greep houdt. Prachtige natuurobservaties, springlevende karakters die intensief je hoofd gaan bevolken, spetterende internationale actie en bloedstollende twists, kortom een razendsnelle maaltijd om je dwangmatig bladerende vingers uiterst nerveus bij af te likken. Zorgvuldig word je als lezer meegezogen in een waarlijk filmisch epos, fantastisch fictief maar tegelijkertijd tergend plausibel. Afgezet tegen een bloedstollende achtergrond van politieke en ecologische realiteit legt Bos op spannende, vlijmscherpe en vooral ook humoristische wijze de vinger op de zere plek, daarbij gretig schrapend aan zowel sluimerend als ontwaakt moreel-ethisch bewustzijn. Hij schroomt dan ook niet om vooral man en paard te noemen, speciaal daar waar het gaat om inmiddels welbekende, destabiliserende machiavellistische (f)actoren in onze sociale en natuurlijke omgeving. De perverse symbiose tussen politiek, industrie, monetaire macht en het alles omvattende waanidee van wereldwijde beheersbaarheid wordt blootgelegd in al zijn desastreuze consequenties. Als antithese pareert Johan Bos deze doorgedraaide zelfwaan op grootse wijze met de ontzagwekkende oerkracht van de natuur, een onvoorspelbaar spel van krachten en invloeden dat ons zou moeten doen buigen, in respect, nederigheid en dienstbaarheid. Want ook al is onze Natuur een onvoorwaardelijk liefhebbende Moeder, ze is tegelijkertijd een heel strenge. Bos serveert de lezer een totaalmenu, in verschillende rijk geschakeerde gangen, verbazingwekkend qua ingrediënten, compositie en textuur. Refugium is een echte lekkernij, ademt diepe spanning en urgentie, is een page turner eerste klas, en drukt je, mede door een kraker van een ontknoping, op niet mis verstane wijze met je neus op een ontluisterende holistische realiteit. Wakker worden! Het gebeurt hier, en nu! No Time To Waste!Oscar--------


VerslaafdKleine update. Ondertussen redelijk verslaafd en met angst en beven zie ik station Utrecht alweer naderen. Op dit moment denk ik strik erom en boekenweekgeschenk.Jan-----
Spannend en goed geschreven.Nadja--------
Een mustDoor een keten van stemmingen ben ik heengegaan bij het lezen van Refugium. Het gevoel dat ik echt in 'de juiste film' zat, tot aan bijna het einde van het boek... De laatste stemming zit me nog steeds het meeste dwars, geen happy ending namelijk... Maar misschien is dit wel precies wat de schrijver beoogt met dit boek? Het weergeven van de kneiterharde werkelijkheid in de huidige wereld. Het blijven aansporen tot nog meer bewustzijn en vooral tot nog meer actie om jouw eigen bijdrage te leveren aan een betere wereld. Dit is in ieder geval wat het mij heeft gedaan.De karakters, de details, de opbouw, op het verkeerde been gezet worden, de spanning, dit alles maakte dat ik het boek eigenlijk geen seconde wilde neerleggen. Schrijver Bos heeft een boodschap te brengen. Hopelijk zullen er nog vele boeken van zijn hand volgen.Dorien---------
Levendige bewustwording! Echt een aanrader!Veel zinnige informatie wordt in een hoog tempo doorgegeven. Je blijft geboeid doorlezen... Neem alle tijd voor dit bijzondere boek, stoppen met lezen gaat je niet lukken :-) Echt een aanrader voor alle Bourgondiërs en natuurliefhebbers, eigenlijk voor iedereen een must!Josta--------
Een eye openerEen boek wat je aan het denken zet, en toch makkelijk leest… Waarbij je wegdroomt bij de prachtige natuurbeelden die beschreven worden… Een boek met humor en veel ruimte voor eigen interpretatie. Zo’n boek waar je het gevoel hebt dat je in twee werelden tegelijk leeft, de werkelijkheid en het verhaal. Het bizarre feit is dat het verhaal helaas ook werkelijkheid is… Johan Bos snijdt een zeer belangrijk onderwerp aan; duistere en realistische ontwikkelingen die in de wereld gaande zijn… We hebben er allemaal mee te maken, maar wie is zich er daadwerkelijk van bewust? We raken steeds meer vervreemd als natuurlijk wezen en raken verstrengeld in een maatschappij die enkel gericht is op het machtiger en rijker worden van een selecte groep mensen. We werken er allemaal aan mee, hoe kun je ook anders… Is ons water nog wel veilig? En ons eten? Kunnen we de lucht veilig inademen? Hebben we nog privacy of worden we allemaal onbewust in de gaten gehouden en via sluwe technieken gemanipuleerd? In een ontzettend spannend en meeslepend verhaal wordt er dieper ingegaan op de wereld van genetische manipulatie. Een must voor iedereen die wakker wil zijn, wil weten wat er écht aan de hand is! Al kun je het niet direct veranderen, ‘leef zo puur, realistisch en bewust mogelijk’… Wat is logisch? Ga te rade bij je diepe oerverstand en doe niet mee aan deze verschrikkelijke mallemolen. Dat is een waardevolle boodschap die ik uit het boek heb gehaald. Een eye-opener…
Pluspunten: Fantasierijk, goed plot, meeslepend verhaal, spannendMowDee------------

Short Summary

Robert Pincer spent his first 20 years growing up in Oklahoma where he was greatly influenced by the bible belt culture. Scouting, from Cub through Explorer, Methodist Youth Fellowship, and sports provided a brain committee with foundation of faith, team spirit and patriotism from parents, scout leaders, coaches, preachers and teachers.

“We were poor but we didn't know it,” he says of his family. “But I knew if I wanted anything other than food and clothes I would have to work to buy it myself.” He mowed lawns, threw newspapers and worked in the hay fields before he was old enough to get a job as a soda jerk and then as a short order cook. Later he worked as a car hop for a root beer stand and a restaurant with a drive-in before hooking up with a magazine sales crew. He earned and saved enough in the sales job, in three summers, to pay for his freshman year at Oklahoma University while hoping for a football scholarship in order to continue. An OU scholarship didn't happen but the coaches there referred him to other schools and coaches and he wound up transferring to Junior College on a full scholarship.

Marriage, two seasons of football, and selection as a Junior College All American resulted in several scholarship offers but the best one required an exodus from Oklahoma to accept an extended full ride at the University of New Mexico.

A tragic miscarriage and a devastating divorce produced a deep depression exacerbated by long term excessive alcohol use and served to repopulate his brain committee with bitter and cynical members. In spite of the agonizing circumstances and sore state of mind, he presented a cheerful and friendly façade. He eventually graduated college, and was commissioned in the United States Marine Corps with orders to flight school.

The eventual culmination of a 20 year downward spiral of depression resulted in an introduction to Alcoholics Anonymous which led to a new life of sobriety. His hope is that the publication of his story will inspire others to find sobriety and peace in their life.

Your contributions will go toward publishing and publicity costs. If the goals in this campaign are not reached Slurred Saga will be published but the publicity to promote it will not be available.

If  you can not contribute, please pass the word to friends and family with the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
** THIS CAMPAIGN HAS COME TO AN END BUT THERE'LL BE ANOTHER FUNDING ROUND IN THE SPRING - SEE UPDATES AND THE FACEBOOK PAGE FOR MORE INFORMATION.  MANY THANKS FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT **

I’m a writer and traditional musician living in Sussex with a background in environmental campaigning, environmental education and archaeological interpretation and reconstruction.  Currently, I’m trying to raise some cash to fund a new edition of my book, ‘Nine Miles: Two Winters of Anti-Road Protest’.  As the title suggests, the book helps describe, from a personal viewpoint, the anti-road protests in Britain in the nineteen nineties, chiefly the campaign against the Newbury Bypass on Berkshire/Hampshire county line. 

That’s a familiar story for many, but it’s easy to forget that others may never have been aware of or know very little about those times.  Thousands of people were involved, occupying trees and dealing with the cold and stress of confrontations with security and evictions, but also remaining deeply rooted to the land, even as we watched so much of it being taken away.

It’s a huge part of our social history and - with a massive road-building programme once again underway - it remains as pertinent as ever.  But it contains another story than simply another confrontation with the state; how it can be when people try and live lightly for instance, what can occur when we step away from the suburbs and cities, how it feels to find a sense of belonging amid a world that can often feel so isolating and remote.

CATALYSTS

‘Nine Miles’ is just one memento of all this.  It was a time of resistance, but also a cultural flowering; free parties, squats and wild living, traditional music played under the trees, remembering and telling old stories. It was about reclaiming the right to live on the land and stood as a clarion call for the future.  Today, with the consequences of having had our collective heads in the sand for so long being only too clear, voices of what real cultural catalysts can look and feel like are probably as important as ever.

Perhaps that’s the greatest lesson of those times; how things can be when people come together to act on their best intuitions; motivated by the deep need for a sense of a shift.  That may or not may not be allied to protest – and for my part, from necessity’s sake, protest is a thing from my past.  But for a sense of the pace of the wider change needed, the story of Newbury retains a great force.

THE BONES OF IT

This is an open ended project – those contributing receive a copy of the book at market prices; that’s £10 plus postage and packing.  Raising over £1000 ensures a small scale print run with Print On Demand technology that will enable the book to remain funded for future print runs so long as people want to buy it.  Over £5000 ensures a print run at cost price with a top-of-the-range printers run as a workers’ co-op. 

For those who own a copy of the book already or who would like to contribute something extra, I’ll be printing another run of our book of poetry, ‘Heartfires’ with poems from River Jones and beautiful woodcut illustrations by Rebecca Tann.  And for the first 100 takers I’ll throw in a copy of either one of my other poetry books – ‘Throwing Lights’ with Laura Joy and Oliver Tate or a copy of my cartoon booklet ‘Wu, the Taoist with the Broken Arm’.  Any extra proceeds will go into the project, helping fund cheaper print runs and in the event of not reaching £1000, all contributions will be refunded.

REMEMBERING

By supporting this print run you’ll have in your hands a record of a truly inspiring episode in our more recent history, and you’ll be helping keep alive too the memory of what can take place when people come together to act on behalf of both our immediate surroundings and wider world itself.  This will be the third edition of Nine Miles since it was first published in 2006; small-scale print runs that sold well and were received warmly – for reviews and more information, see the main nine miles site. 

Nine Miles is a book that unavoidably deals with the politics of protest.  There are many people who were involved at the time for whom a return to that kind of action is no longer an option, just as there are many more that have since chosen apparently less immediate, though no less current, ways of making a difference.  People put a great deal on the line during those protests and the experience of confrontation was often a defining aspect of the time.  It remains my great hope that if we could remember with greater vividness what happened all those years ago it would make a rerun all the less necessary.  But when the need for action is there Newbury and other campaigns stand as a reminder of what that action can look like.  To the ten thousand trees then and the thousands of people involved, this is my tribute; I hope it proves a fitting one for a time of such dedication and passion.

story:
Contenido en español disponible abajo.

History

While this story started a long time ago, it happened all because of a study abroad scholarship I received through the University of Michigan School of Social Work to do an oral history project in Guatemala with communities I have worked with in the past.

At La Escuela de la Montana (The Mountain School) where I learned Spanish, community leaders often come to speak with foreign students to give talks about their community's struggle on plantations to demand their worker's rights, their subsequent displacement and their struggle of starting over in a new land. However, I learned while doing these oral histories with community members that the children and youth here do not fully know their own community history.

As these communities are two or more generations beyond the struggle they had on the coffee plantations where they all were born and raised and worked, I felt important to find a way to give back. In collaboration with a young man from the community who is a brilliant artist, we embarked on this journey of bringing the community's history to life into this book. 

Named Confía en la Lucha, the young adult book follows a young girl named Ceiba as she grows up on a finca (plantation) as she watches her father organize the workers into a union to demand their back pay. Later, when Ceiba is 15 years old, she joins the struggle and helps the workers find land. And from there it follows the history of the community.

Written based on oral histories, edited by Spanish language teachers and read and revised by multiple young people in Guatemala, this has truly been a collaborative effort. And it is ready to come to life.  

 

What We Need: 

We are now finishing up the edits, putting the final touches on the illustrations and are preparing to publish. Here's where we need your help.

I have contacted several printers and spoken with my uncle who has his own printing company. In short, self-publishing is expensive.

                 For 100 books the cost is $1,113. The expensive part is the set up to print.
                 After that, copies are actually rather cheap: about $1.21 for each book.

We would like to publish 500 books so that each family can have a copy and the same for every young adult who receives a scholarship for secondary education provided by La Escuela de la Montana. Printing this quantity of books will provide copies to scholarship recipients for the next 3 years.

To print 500 books, the cost is $1600. We are asking for $2150 to cover costs of shipping and tariffs, which quickly add another $500.

We invite you to be part of this community oral history book project! There are three (3) levels of giving:

1).  $1 - $25 = Every $1.21 donated = one (1) book provided to scholarship students*

2). $26 - $75 = Provides 21 - 61 books to scholarship recipients* and donors will be provided with an English and/or Spanish eBook version of your choice.

3).  $76 + = Provides 62 to innumerable books to scholarship recipients*, access to English and/or Spanish eBook version of your choice and your own copy of the book**.

*-Cost of each copy of book after set up costs is $1.21. Set up costs run about $1100.

**-As we are printing copies locally and providing them to local communities in Guatemala, books will be in Spanish. There is a limit of 40 donors receiving their own copy of the book. All donors above $26 will receive an eBook version (English and/or Spanish will be available).

 
 

The Impact

 

I cannot begin to describe to you the impact this project has had on my life. It truly has been a privilege to be in Guatemala working with such wonderful people.

The truth of the matter is that it is rare for children to have access to books here in Guatemala, particularly in their own home. The Mountain School provides a community library where children often come after school to read. However, it only open during certain hours. One community leader, Ruben, said it best:

"I could read the book in the community library when I could find time to go. But it would be really, really nice to have a copy for my family. I have given lots of interviews to former students and have presented my story often to the school, but I have never seen a product or a result of them. I am really looking forward to reading the story and sharing it with my children."

Through La Escuela de la Montana, young adults receive scholarships to attend secondary school. The recipients already meet monthly to discuss themes such as gang violence, sex education, how to apply to college and Guatemalan history. Many of those who have given talks to the youth have commented how this book can help them develop a more succinct curriculum based on their own community's history.

This is, perhaps, one of the first times this community's history has been recorded and printed. Not only does the book present the community's history, it discusses the value of collective action, activism, unions and how important community unity has been in fighting unfair wages, oppression, starvation and helped them survive and overcome. Moreover, it presents issues that young adults face today.

Imagine the potential:

               -80 families each have a copy of the book.

               -Between 80-100 scholarship recipients will receive their own copy of the
                book for the next 3 years.

               -More than 50 Spanish language teachers will have access to the book (in
               the school's library) to teach more of Guatemalan history.

               -A young adult curriculum can be developed around issues facing youth
               today (i.e. gang violence, displacement, migration, unemployment and
               poverty) while emphasizing collective action, community unity, and
               cultivating what is called the Guatemalan Dream

               -Hundreds of people will learn a facet of Guatemalan history that is
               unknown to most and from the perspective of the community.


Risks and Challenges

We have decided to use Indiegogo's Flexible Fundraising option so that no matter what we will see this project through with whatever funding we have. We will face some limitations if more than 40 individuals wish to have a hard copy of the book.
When we began this project, printing copies this book was the first goal. As we dove further in, others became interested in purchasing copies. Now we have the opportunity to meet both needs.   
 
 

Other Ways to Help:

Interested in helping but cannot donate at the moment? No worries! We really need help spreading the word!

Please share this link, share that of the La Escuela de la Montana: www.escuelamontana.org, and share the link of Café Red KAT that works with deportees and Guatemalan youth to cultivate the Guatemalan Dream in place of the American Dream: www.cafered.org.

Plan a trip to Guatemala one day and come study Spanish and learn more about the Guatemalan Dream!


En Español:

Historia:

Mientras este cuento empezó hace muchos años, podía ser realizada por una beca que yo recibí por fondos de la escuela de trabajo social en la Universidad de Michigan para hacer un proyecto de historias orales en Guatemala con comunidades rurales.

En La Escuela de la Montaña donde aprendí español, líderes de las comunidades presentan sus historias a los estudiantes extranjeros sobre la lucha de la comunidad en las fincas, exigiendo sus derechos laborales y su desplazamiento subsiguiente. Sin embargo, mientras yo hacía las grabaciones de las historias orales con miembros de la comunidad, me di cuenta que los niños y jóvenes no saben su propia historia.

Porque aquellos comunidades ya tienen dos generaciones más allá de la lucha en la finca donde todas las personas nacieron y crecieron, yo quise encontrar alguna manera donde pudiera ayudar. En colaboración con un artista de la comunidad, empecemos este proyecto de crear un libro de la historia de la comunidad.

Llamado Confía en la Lucha, este libro para jóvenes sigue una niña que se llamaba Ceiba en su niñez en la finca y sus observaciones de su papá quien organizaba los trabajadores y se formaron un sindicato para exigir sus pagos atrasados. Después, cuando Ceiba tenía 15 años, ella se unió la lucha y los ayudó a los trabajadores encontrar su propia tierra. Desde allá, el cuento sigue la historia de la comunidad hasta hoy en día.

Escrito en base de historias orales, revisado por maestros de español, leído y revisado por jóvenes guatemaltecos, este esfuerzo ha sido una colaboración verdadero. Ya está lista para ser imprimido.


Lo que necesitamos:

Ya estamos terminando las revisiones, arreglando el libro con las ilustraciones y preparando para la imprenta. Aquí es donde necesitamos su ayuda.

He contactado muchas imprentas y hablado con mi tío quien tiene su propia imprenta. Es muy caro publicar un libro.

              Para 100 libros, el costo es Q8352. La parte más caro es la preparación. Después
              copias del libro son muy baratos: mas o menos Q9 cada libro.

Quisiéramos publicar 500 libros para que cada familia tenga su propia copia y el mismo para cada joven quien reciba una beca para básico o diversificado que es proveído por La Escuela de la Montaña. Esta cantidad de libros proveería copias para los becados por los próximos 3 años.

El costo de imprenta de 500 libros es Q12000. Estamos pidiendo Q16125 en total para cubrir los gastos de transporte de libros, tarifas--lo que agregan un costo de Q3750.

Le invitamos ser parte de este proyecto del libro de historias orales. Hay 3 niveles de colaboración:

1).  $1 - $25 (Q7.5 - Q187.50) = Cada Q9 donado = 1 libro para un becado*

2). $26 - $75 (Q195 - Q562.50) = Provea entre 21 - 61 libros para becados* y los patrocinadores recibirán una copia electrónico del libro en inglés y español.

3). $76 o más (Q570 o más) = Provea 62 o más libros a los becados, los patrocinadores recibirán una copia electrónico del libro en inglés y español y su propia copia del libro.**

*-Costo de cada copia del libro después de los costes de preparación es Q9. Costo de preparación es Q8352.

**-Porque estamos imprimiendo copias con una imprenta local y proveyendo copias para 2 comunidades rurales en Guatemala, los libros serán en español. Hay un limite de 40 patrocinadores que recibirán su propia copia del libro. Todos los patrocinadores que dona más que Q195 recibirán una versión electrónica bilingüe.

El Impacto:

No puede describirse a usted el impacto este proyecto ha hecho en mi vida. Verdaderamente, ha sido un privilegio estar en Guatemala trabajando con gente maravillosa.

La verdad es esto: es raro para los niños tenga acceso a los libros aquí en Guatemala, especialmente en su casa. La Escuela de la Montaña tiene una biblioteca donde los niños leen. Sin embargo, solo está abierto unas horas durante la semana. Un líder de la comunidad, Rubén, dijo:

--Pueda leer el libro en la biblioteca comunitaria cuando tenga el tiempo. Pero sería muy muy bonito tener una copia para mi familia. He dado bastantes entrevistas a los estudiantes y he presentado la historia de la comunidad muchas veces en la escuela de español pero nunca he visto un ningún resultado. Estoy muy muy emocionado recibir un libro y no puedo esperar leer el cuento. Me da gusto a compartirlo con mis hijos.

La Escuela de la Montaña provee becas para que los jóvenes puedan asistir básico o diversificado Los becados ya tienen reuniones cada mes y tienen presentaciones con temas como violencia de maras, educación sexual, como asistir la universidad y la historia de Guatemala. Muchos de los que daban presentaciones a los jóvenes han comentado que este libro podría ayudarles a desarrollar un currículo más especifico en base de la historia de la comunidad.

Eso es, quizás unas de las primeras veces que la historia de la comunidad ha sido grabado, escrito, e imprimido--todo por y para la comunidad. El cuento incluye la historia de la comunidad y presenta los valores de acción colectivo, activismo, sindicatos y la importancia de unidad de la comunidad para luchar contra pagos desiguales, opresión, hambre y como la unidad les ayudaban a sobrevivir. Además el cuento presenta asuntos que los jóvenes enfrentan hoy en día.

Fijase la potencial:

          -Cada familia tiene su propia copia del libro (80 familias).

          -Entre 80 y 100 becados recibirían su propia copia del libro para los siguientes 3 años.

          -Más que 50 maestros de español podrán tener acceso al libro (en la biblioteca de la
          escuela) para enseñar más de la historia de Guatemala.

          -Un currículo para los jóvenes podría ser desarrollada (con temas como violencia de
          maras, desplazamiento, migración, falta de empleo y pobreza) y enfatizar acción
          colectivo, unidad, y como cultivar el sueño guatemalteco en lugar del sueño americano.

          -Cientos de personas aprendería una parte de la historia de Guatemala que no está
          conocido pero es del punto de vista de la comunidad.

Riesgos y desafíos:

Nosotros hemos decidido usar la opción de crecimiento de fondos flexible para que podamos superar este proyecto no importa la cantidad que creceríamos. Hará unas limitaciones si más que 40 personas desearían su propia copia del libro.

Cuando empecemos este proyecto, la imprenta del libro era la primer meta. Durante el proyecto muchas nos dijeron que quisieran comprar una copia. Ahora podemos realizar los dos.

Otras maneras de ayuda:

¿Interesado pero no puede donar ahorita? No se preocupe. Nosotros necesitamos con el corre del voz.

Por favor, comparte este vínculo, el vínculo de La Escuela de la Montaña: www.escuelamontana.org, y el de La Red KAT que trabaja con deportados y jóvenes guatemaltecos para cultivar el sueño guatemalteco: www.cafered.org.

!Plantificar un viaje para visitar Guatemala, estudiar español y aprender más sobre el sueño Guatemalteco!

Contenido en español disponible abajo.History 
While this story started a long time ago, it happened all because of a study abroad scholarship I received through the University of Michigan School of Social Work to do an oral history project in Guatemala with communities I have worked with in the past. 
At La Escuela de la Montana (The Mountain School) where I learned Spanish, community leaders often come to speak with foreign students to give talks about their community's struggle on plantations to demand their worker's rights, their subsequent displacement and their struggle of starting over in a new land. However, I learned while doing these oral histories with community members that the children and youth here do not fully know their own community history.
As these communities are two or more generations beyond the struggle they had on the coffee plantations where they all were born and raised and worked, I felt important to find a way to give back. In collaboration with a young man from the community who is a brilliant artist, we embarked on this journey of bringing the community's history to life into this book. 
Named Confía en la Lucha, the young adult book follows a young girl named Ceiba as she grows up on a finca (plantation) as she watches her father organize the workers into a union to demand their back pay. Later, when Ceiba is 15 years old, she joins the struggle and helps the workers find land. And from there it follows the history of the community. 
Written based on oral histories, edited by Spanish language teachers and read and revised by multiple young people in Guatemala, this has truly been a collaborative effort. And it is ready to come to life.  
 What We Need: 
We are now finishing up the edits, putting the final touches on the illustrations and are preparing to publish. Here's where we need your help. 
I have contacted several printers and spoken with my uncle who has his own printing company. In short, self-publishing is expensive. 
                 For 100 books the cost is $1,113. The expensive part is the set up to print.                  After that, copies are actually rather cheap: about $1.21 for each book. 
We would like to publish 500 books so that each family can have a copy and the same for every young adult who receives a scholarship for secondary education provided by La Escuela de la Montana. Printing this quantity of books will provide copies to scholarship recipients for the next 3 years. 
To print 500 books, the cost is $1600. We are asking for $2150 to cover costs of shipping and tariffs, which quickly add another $500.
We invite you to be part of this community oral history book project! There are three (3) levels of giving:
1).  $1 - $25 = Every $1.21 donated = one (1) book provided to scholarship students*
2). $26 - $75 = Provides 21 - 61 books to scholarship recipients* and donors will be provided with an English and/or Spanish eBook version of your choice.
3).  $76 + = Provides 62 to innumerable books to scholarship recipients*, access to English and/or Spanish eBook version of your choice and your own copy of the book**.
*-Cost of each copy of book after set up costs is $1.21. Set up costs run about $1100. 
**-As we are printing copies locally and providing them to local communities in Guatemala, books will be in Spanish. There is a limit of 40 donors receiving their own copy of the book. All donors above $26 will receive an eBook version (English and/or Spanish will be available).
  The Impact I cannot begin to describe to you the impact this project has had on my life. It truly has been a privilege to be in Guatemala working with such wonderful people. 
The truth of the matter is that it is rare for children to have access to books here in Guatemala, particularly in their own home. The Mountain School provides a community library where children often come after school to read. However, it only open during certain hours. One community leader, Ruben, said it best:
"I could read the book in the community library when I could find time to go. But it would be really, really nice to have a copy for my family. I have given lots of interviews to former students and have presented my story often to the school, but I have never seen a product or a result of them. I am really looking forward to reading the story and sharing it with my children."
Through La Escuela de la Montana, young adults receive scholarships to attend secondary school. The recipients already meet monthly to discuss themes such as gang violence, sex education, how to apply to college and Guatemalan history. Many of those who have given talks to the youth have commented how this book can help them develop a more succinct curriculum based on their own community's history. 
This is, perhaps, one of the first times this community's history has been recorded and printed. Not only does the book present the community's history, it discusses the value of collective action, activism, unions and how important community unity has been in fighting unfair wages, oppression, starvation and helped them survive and overcome. Moreover, it presents issues that young adults face today. 
Imagine the potential:
               -80 families each have a copy of the book.
               -Between 80-100 scholarship recipients will receive their own copy of the                 book for the next 3 years. 
               -More than 50 Spanish language teachers will have access to the book (in                the school's library) to teach more of Guatemalan history. 
               -A young adult curriculum can be developed around issues facing youth                today (i.e. gang violence, displacement, migration, unemployment and                poverty) while emphasizing collective action, community unity, and                cultivating what is called the Guatemalan Dream 
               -Hundreds of people will learn a facet of Guatemalan history that is                unknown to most and from the perspective of the community.

Risks and ChallengesWe have decided to use Indiegogo's Flexible Fundraising option so that no matter what we will see this project through with whatever funding we have. We will face some limitations if more than 40 individuals wish to have a hard copy of the book. When we began this project, printing copies this book was the first goal. As we dove further in, others became interested in purchasing copies. Now we have the opportunity to meet both needs.     Other Ways to Help:
Interested in helping but cannot donate at the moment? No worries! We really need help spreading the word! 
Please share this link, share that of the La Escuela de la Montana: www.escuelamontana.org, and share the link of Café Red KAT that works with deportees and Guatemalan youth to cultivate the Guatemalan Dream in place of the American Dream: www.cafered.org. 
Plan a trip to Guatemala one day and come study Spanish and learn more about the Guatemalan Dream!

story:
Resumen

Imperfectu es una plataforma donde el cine, la academia, el arte y el activismo se combinan para crear un festival que explora temáticas relacionadas al cuerpo, la sexualidad y el género.

Somos el primer y único festival de cine y estudios de género en el noroeste de México. Hasta la fecha, hemos realizado dos ediciones en la ciudad de Tijuana, México: la primera en abril 2014 y la más reciente en julio de 2015.

Imperfectu cuenta con un equipo extenso que ha ayudado a realizar las dos ediciones del festival. Somos un cuerpo multidisciplinario que lucha por mantener el proyecto en pie, nuestro esfuerzo ha dado grandes frutos y es por ello que deseamos seguir innovando, de forma creativa y comprometida con la diversidad, las muchas formas de hacer arte en Tijuana y el resto de México.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Queremos reunir 6 mil USD para cerrar nuestra edición 2016 y desarrollar IMPERFECTU APP, un directorio digital que permitirá a tijuanenses y turistas en Tijuana hallar lugares y eventos incluyentes y libres de discriminación sexual, física, afectiva o racial. Con esta aplicación podrán calificar y consultar recomendaciones sobre restaurantes, cafés, asociaciones, instituciones, clubes, festivales, y demás.

Desde su nacimiento, Imperfectu ha contado con el apoyo de diversas instituciones y marcas, tanto locales como nacionales. Sin embargo, detrás de las ideas, la programación, la logística, el diseño, la comunicación, la publicidad, la promoción, la imagen y la administración, hay un incansable equipo que ha trabajado siempre con recursos propios, movido por el amor que le tiene a este proyecto.

Actualmente Imperfectu, un festival independiente, lucha por mantenerse activo para sus siguientes ediciones. Para ello, planea desarrollar IMPERFECTU APP, como un nuevo modelo de recaudación de fondos, el cual le permitirá contar con recursos de una forma más estable. Estos fondos vendrán de las cuotas fijadas mensualmente a los establecimientos y eventos que busquen comprometerse con el respeto de los derechos de las comunidades LGBTTIQ, y deseen formar parte del directorio.

Una vez alcanzada la meta, te agradeceremos mediante nuestras redes sociales y nuestra página web o bien te haremos llegar una serie de recompensas, como calcomanías, libros conmemorativos del festival y camisetas. ¡O incluso podrás cenar con unx de nuestrxs invitadxs durante la edición 4 del Festival en 2017!

 

El impacto

Esta aplicación permitirá que la comunidad LGBTTTIQ en Tijuana, y de otras partes del mundo, tenga mayor seguridad y libertad de expresión en una ciudad que despunta como amigable a la diversidad.

Gracias a IMPERFECTU APP muchos establecimientos aparecerán en una plataforma que proporcionará información bilingüe a sus clientes, así como la posibilidad de hacer pedidos en línea o comprar boletos: todo en una sola aplicación.

Por otro lado, la aplicación busca impulsar una imagen más real de Tijuana, visibilizando y ampliando los espacios libres de discriminación que ya existen en la ciudad, y a su vez generar la apertura de nuevos puntos que respeten las diversidades.  

 

Riesgos y desafíos

Si no recaudamos los fondos necesarios para el desarrollo de la aplicación, la posibilidad de ofrecer un directorio recreativo basado en la inclusión y el respeto de los derechos LGBTTTIQ en Tijuana se vería tristemente estancada. Asimismo, no obtendríamos ingresos para continuar con un festival que ha sido icónico en el noroeste de México. 

Por ello, tu ayuda es indispensable, ya que conocemos y sentimos la enorme importancia de este gran proyecto que desmitifica el sistema binario de género basado en la heteronormatividad. La idea es que la comunidad se una a nosotros y así continuemos fortaleciendo una sociedad tijuanense mucho más homologada en la aceptación y el respeto. 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 
  • Comparte el enlace de nuestra campaña en tus redes sociales, o envíalo por chat o correo a tus contactos.
  • Habla de esta campaña a todas las personas de tu comunidad, ya que de boca en boca podremos lograr más impacto.
  • Cuéntanos brevemente en un video (no importa el formato) por qué sería importante contar con una aplicación y un festival como éstos. Envíanos tu video a imperfectufest@gmail.com.

Esta aplicación permitirá que la comunidad LGBTTTIQ en Tijuana, y de otras partes del mundo, tenga mayor seguridad y libertad de expresión en una ciudad que despunta como amigable a la diversidad.
Gracias a IMPERFECTU APP muchos establecimientos aparecerán en una plataforma que proporcionará información bilingüe a sus clientes, así como la posibilidad de hacer pedidos en línea o comprar boletos: todo en una sola aplicación.
Por otro lado, la aplicación busca impulsar una imagen más real de Tijuana, visibilizando y ampliando los espacios libres de discriminación que ya existen en la ciudad, y a su vez generar la apertura de nuevos puntos que respeten las diversidades.   
Riesgos y desafíos
Si no recaudamos los fondos necesarios para el desarrollo de la aplicación, la posibilidad de ofrecer un directorio recreativo basado en la inclusión y el respeto de los derechos LGBTTTIQ en Tijuana se vería tristemente estancada. Asimismo, no obtendríamos ingresos para continuar con un festival que ha sido icónico en el noroeste de México. 
Por ello, tu ayuda es indispensable, ya que conocemos y sentimos la enorme importancia de este gran proyecto que desmitifica el sistema binario de género basado en la heteronormatividad. La idea es que la comunidad se una a nosotros y así continuemos fortaleciendo una sociedad tijuanense mucho más homologada en la aceptación y el respeto. 
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar 
Comparte el enlace de nuestra campaña en tus redes sociales, o envíalo por chat o correo a tus contactos.
Habla de esta campaña a todas las personas de tu comunidad, ya que de boca en boca podremos lograr más impacto.
Cuéntanos brevemente en un video (no importa el formato) por qué sería importante contar con una aplicación y un festival como éstos. Envíanos tu video a imperfectufest@gmail.com.

story:
A Classical Myth Retold

An adaptation of the greek myth of Eros and Psyche, as told in Apuleius' Metamorphoses.

The story is about a young, mortal woman, Psyche, and her abduction by Eros, the god of love. Usually, marriage is the happy ending of a love story; in their case, it's only the beginning.


About Us

We are two research addicts and mythology lovers, who teamed up for this project. The author, Myrto Gkiouli, has taken some classes in creative writing and storytelling, and has been wanting to tell stories since forever. The illustrator, Eirini Skoura, has been drawing since a very young age, and has taken some classes in character design, comic stripping and character sculpting.

The Book

This is our first attempt at a project of this scale, and our aim is to raise the funds necessary in order to turn our story into a fully illustrated book.

Our goal is to print the first 1000 copies of the book, a 72 A4 page, full coloured paperback. The first print will be in English, and hopefully we will be able to print the Greek version at some point down the road.

(a sneak peek of one of the pages)

(...and another one)


The Perks

For your generosity, we have designed some special perks for you.

For instance:

Bookmarks:

Pins:

Two Packs of 4 A5 Cards:

...and much more!


Other Ways You Can Help Us

Contribution isn't all about money.

If you like our project, you can still help by telling your friends about it; share it on social media, because someone else might like it as well!

story:
The Book

Diving Deep, Going Far is a novel about six young women in modern-day Cambodia on their path to create a better future for their country. 

In Cambodia, an old proverb says "Women cannot dive deep, nor go far", which basically means that women can never stray far from their household duties. The women in this book are doing the exact opposite: engaging in leadership in many different parts of society, they are going squarely against the proverb and its oppressive moral.

While Diving Deep, Going Far is technically a novel, it is based on over 25 interviews with young women in Cambodia. As a result, the stories in the book are all based in the reality of today's Cambodia.

CLICK HERE FOR THE SAMPLE CHAPTER

Or learn more about the women in this book HERE

 

Who & Why

Diving Deep, Going Far is written by Menno de Block, with support from Kunthea Chan. Menno was born in the Netherlands and has been living in Cambodia since 2014. To learn more about his background and why he decided to write this book, please have a look at this blog post. Kunthea Chan was born and raised in Cambodia and has been a life-long advocate of women's rights.

Diving Deep, Going Far is written for three purposes:

  • To share the inspiring stories of Cambodia’s new generation of women leaders with an audience around the world 
  • To present a more optimistic image of contemporary Cambodia 
  • To provide a platform for these women to be role models for an even younger generation, and to normalize the narrative of women as leaders in Cambodia. For this purpose, we will also be working on a Khmer version in 2017.

 

The Campaign

Diving Deep, Going Far is currently halfway the second draft, and will probably take another six months until publication. In the mean time, we will try to also get the Khmer version ready for publication.

In order to retain full independence, we have decided to self-publish the book. Unfortunately, this does mean Menno will bear the costs of production and a professional editor, as well as investing half a year of full-time work in finishing the book (Kunthea will provide her support next to her job).

This is why we need your support to make sure Diving Deep, Going Far will actually get there, and get there on time. Our hope is to get 400 pre-orders in this campaign, which will provide the funds necessary to cover all costs ($10,000 total). See the Q&A for what happens if we don't reach this goal.

 

What You Get in Return

This campaign is essentially more a pre-order campaign than a regular crowdfunding campaign. At the most basic level, you will get the book at around the actual retail price - $10 for the e-book and $25 for the hard copy. As we are currently in second draft, we expect to be able to ship the book around June 2017.

Of course, there's more than that. If you wish to offer more support, have a look at the other rewards on the right and below. And, for all levels of support: 5% of the book proceeds will be donated to causes supporting young female leadership in Cambodia and elsewhere in Asia.

 

About the Perks

Buy One, Give One

Select this option, and you will finance the distribution of a copy of the book to a young woman leader in Cambodia. The copy will be either in English or Khmer and will be distributed by one of our partners that work with young leaders in Cambodia. Updates and a report will be provided on this page and the website.

A Proper Woman

A Proper Woman is a forthcoming memoir about being a (young) woman in Cambodia, written by Thavry Thul. As a young author and entrepreneur, Thavry embodies the generation of young women leaders in Diving Deep, Going Far. In her book A Proper Woman, she describes her journey from a very personal perspective. For more info about Thavry and her book, click here.

Lotus Silk Scarf, Tie and Jewelry

Lotus Silk is a Cambodian social enterprise run by Vannary San, one of the women in the book. The company aims to revitalize Cambodia's rich silk heritage and produces high-quality silk products. Its hand-made silk products are high quality and durable.

For a great video about Lotus Silk, see the end of this page.

Dinner with the Author

If you want to learn more about what has driven me to give up a good job, come to Cambodia and write a book about female leadership, what it was like to meet all the women in the book, or anything else, this exclusive dinner in Phnom Penh is for you!

Digital Meet & Greet

Want to know more about one of the women behind the book and how she inspired your favorite character? If you can't wait to find out what drives her, what her ambitions are, or simply what her favorite Cambodian dish is, this option is for you!

In this exclusive 1-hour digital meet & greet, you will have the opportunity to meet one of the women featured in the book. Beforehand, you will have a briefing with the author, so you can make the most out of your meet & greet.

The timing of the meet & greet will depend on your preferences - our suggestion would be after you have read the book itself. The selection of whom you have the meet & greet with depends on your preference, as well as availability. Have a look at our blog for inspiration!

Finally, selecting this option will financially support the leader you meet with: 1/3 of the proceeds will go directly to her.

Sponsorships

A corporate, NGO or social enterprise sponsorship will see your logo on our website as well as on all copies of the book printed in Cambodia. For more information about the possibilities, please contact the author here or through "Ask a question" at the top right of the page.

Leadership Training

Receive a tailored one-day training for your entire team, delivered by the author and two experienced women leaders from Cambodia. The training can be delivered in English and/or Khmer. For more information about the possibilities, please contact the author here or through "Ask a question" at the top right of the page.

 

Q&A

When will I receive the rewards?

The book itself is scheduled for publication around June 2017 (updates will be provided on this page and through email). Other physical rewards will be shipped in January 2017. The dinner and meet & greet can be scheduled at any time during 2017.

What happens if the goal is not met?

This is a campaign with flexible funding, which means that even if the $10,000 goal is not met, your contribution will still count. Depending on how close we do get to the goal, some scenarios are:

  • Later publication. Reaching the goal will enable Menno to focus full time on finishing the book. If the goal is not met, this may mean having to combine the book with another job, which will likely lead to a later publication date.
  • No professional editor. A significant portion of the funds are designated for a professional editor. Of course we want the book to be of the highest quality, but if we do not reach the goal, this may be an area for cost savings.

In any case, we will continue to provide you with updates after the campaign ends, to let you know how exactly the funds raised are being used and what final publication date you can expect.

No signed copies?

We realize that it is customary to offer signed copies of books in campaigns like these. Unfortunately, shipping books out of Cambodia is a very costly and uncertain affair. To keep down costs and make sure you will actually receive the book in 2017, we decided to opt for shipping them straight from the printer.

Who will the 5% go to?

5% of the proceeds of the book (not just in the campaign, but for all future copies sold) will go to support young female leadership in Cambodia and elsewhere in Asia, through selected partner organizations. Partner selection is still in the works, so keep an eye on this page and the website for more details coming up. After the publication date, the website will feature an ongoing report of how much support has been given to which exact organizations.

 

More about Lotus Silk

story:
La situation et les personnes impliquées

Matthew a causé d'importants dommages à Port-Salut, une ville côtière du sud où j’ai séjourné à deux reprises avec mon ami Emmanuel Dupuy. Emmanuel est né en Haïti et vit à Montréal depuis 1977. Je le connais depuis plus de vingt ans, il est mon ami cher. En 2011, il s’est construit une petite maison à Port-Salut, où l’ouragan a détruit la plupart des habitations. La sienne, en blocs de béton, a été épargnée, et c’est là que ses voisins ont trouvé refuge le jour de l’ouragan. Ce sont ces voisins moins chanceux que nous souhaitons aider. À ces sinistrés s’ajoute la grand-mère d’Emmanuel, âgée de 87 ans, qui a vu sa case gravement endommagée à Gros-Marin, non loin de Port-Salut (il s'agit de la petite maison de la photo plus haut). 

Avec un toit, ces gens pourraient commencer à réorganiser leur vie. D’autant plus que c’est la saison des pluies actuellement.

Pour un état sommaire des lieux:

  • AlterPresse, Réseau alternatif haïtien d'information, 24 octobre 2016.
  • Le devoir, 20 octobre 2016

Le plan d’action

Pour participer à la réparation des maisons des gens visés par cette campagne, je vous propose de contribuer au FONDS DU QUINCAILLIER, qui servira essentiellement à acheter des matériaux de construction. Emmanuel connaît bien le quincaillier local et prendra une entente lui. C’est aussi Emmanuel qui veillera à la gestion efficace de nos sous et à une distribution équitable des ressources entre les personnes sinistrées que nous souhaitons soutenir.

Chaque dollar offert se traduira en clous, tôle, ciment, truelles...

Merci de vous joindre à Emmanuel et à moi pour soutenir ses voisins de Port-Salut et sa grand-mère. Le FONDS DU QUINCAILLIER les aidera à retrouver un toit. Aucun don ne sera trop petit pour eux.

Merci à tous et à toutes de faire connaître notre campagne de sociofinancement.

____________________

Aparté  

Dans le passé, j’ai réalisé deux collectes de fonds qui ont fait une différence pour des sinistrés haïtiens ou des réfugiés syriens :

  • En 2010, à la suite du séisme qui avait dévasté Haïti, une collecte pour les proches d’Emmanuel Dupuy avait suscité la solidarité de mon entourage. C’est Emmanuel qui avait assuré l’acheminement des dons. Ainsi, plusieurs membres et proches de sa famille avaient pu recevoir des ressources essentielles dans le contexte de cette catastrophe.
  • En 2015, pour la famille de Lara Karazivan, mon amie d’enfance d’origine syrienne, une autre campagne était mise en place pour soutenir des membres de sa famille toujours en Syrie. L’argent recueilli (6 451 $) a été envoyé là-bas à un oncle de Lara et sa famille. Un don de 12 000 $ a ensuite facilité l’installation au Québec d’un cousin de Lara, de sa femme et de leur petit garçon.

____________________

Pour aider plus ou autrement

  • La campagne de sociofinancement du journaliste et réalisateur Joseph Hessel pour soutenir une famille de l’Île-à-Vache, durement touchée par l'ouragan Matthew
  • Une campagne pour réhabiliter des écoles à Camp-Perrin à la suite de l'ouragan Matthew
  • La page Facebook « Effective Aid for Haiti after Hurricane Matthew », qui dresse une liste d’organisations locales fiables répondant à des besoins urgents

____________________

Emmanuel et moi remercions Lyne Lefebvre pour son éloquent logo.

story:
The Thank you Canada Story 

Incorporated in 2013; One 50 Canada Society is a non-for-profit society dedicated to support, create and execute artistic and cultural projects linked to Canada's 150th anniversary celebrations in 2017. The main supported project of the One 50 Canada Society being the Thank you Canada project, a unique interactive project on contemporary Canada.

Largely self funding our expeditions, we have now traveled over 50,000km across our vast country. We have made it this far, but creating the largest project in Canadian history is much bigger than any one or two people can achieve. Your help and support will guarantee that we can keep moving forward sharing Canada's stories and making sure that when Canada celebrates its 200th anniversary it's history and people from 2017 will be remembered. Now is the time to create a gift for Canada's future; a gift for our children and grandchildren living in 2067.

Thank you Canada is not just a story about Canada, it's a father and son story; our names are Martin and Martin Gregus and this is our gift for Canada’s 150th anniversary.

Martin Gregus, M.F.A. 

The president and founder of the One 50 Canada Society; with a masters degree in fine art and documentary photography, Martin has over 35 years of  experience in commercial and fashion photography, advertising and publishing. Martin has worked as creative director for advertising agencies MARK/BBDO and GRADE/ TBWA, for customers such SAP, UPS, McDonalds, Levis, Mercedes-Benz, Ford and many others. 

Martin Gregus Jr. 

An internationally awarded photographer and graduated documentary filmmaker. Martin has over 12 years experience in photography and has dedicated much of his life to capturing wildlife, beauty and people’s stories through images both in nature and in the cities. Martin is currently working as the project director for One 50 Canada Society and as a freelance photographer and filmmaker.

The Thank you Canada Expedition 

The book, exhibition and documentary are the final products of the Thank you Canada project however the biggest inspiration comes from the Thank you Canada Expedition itself. When we set out to photograph the country one small step at a time, finding the right seasons, people, events and local traditions, we will capture the pure beauty and spirit of each province and territory. 

From now until 2018 we will travel over 100,000 km across Canada capturing new stories, images and videos from across the country. Live coverage, reports and blogs from the journey will be shared on the Thank you Canada expedition interactive website and on popular social media sites to attract a younger and larger audience.

 

The Thank you Canada Book

Thank you Canada is a 600-page (28cm x 45cm/11x 17.7) full color coffee table book. 

The 600-page Thank you Canada book will be divided into chapters between every province and territory. The chapters will be approximately 30-50 pages long, including scenic panorama fold-outs and many double-page photographs. The book structure will also include a segment of Canadian and provincial history written by renowned Canadian historians, featuring copies of authentic historical documents and photographs. The book will be printed bilingual in English and French, and fulfilled with full online multimedia support. 

CANADAY - My Day in Canada book. 

  • CANADAY is a 200 page black & white documentary book. This book will encompass the authentic documentation from the Thank you Canada expedition, with pictures of people we met, places we visited and the variety of events that took place during our travels across Canada. 

Thank you Canada Special Collectors Edition 

  • There will be a custom made Collectors Edition of the Thank you Canada book in a limited edition of 500 pieces, signed by authors and contributors. This intricately crafted hand binded book will have a cover made from real maple leafs and printed on high quality fine art paper.

 

The Thank you Canada Exhibition 

The intrinsic and most visible part of the project is the Thank you Canada exhibition. In 2018 and during the years following the release of of the Thank you Canada book and documentary, this major interactive photography, multimedia and artifacts exhibition composed of more than 100 of the best images from the expedition will be hosted in every capital city of Canada. This exhibition will be a tremendous interactive adventure for all Canadians and tourists who will discover places that exist just beyond their doorsteps without them even knowing it. 

The Thank you Canada Documentary 

2017 - The Thank you Canada Story - Feature Length Documentary 

The three year trans Canada expeditions are the opportunity to create a timeless documentary the 2017 - The Thank you Canada Story. In this feature length dynamic documentary, we will showcase the highlights from the Thank you Canada expedition in all possible natural conditions and visual angles. The behind the scenes stories will bring the audience straight into the lives of the team that made it all possible as well as the communities, people and places that helped to create this incredible project. 

Emotionally, visually and even with the feels and smells the projection of 2017 - The Thank you Canada Story on screen will be a trully compelling visual experience. From their living rooms viewers will be able to experience our journey across Canada; by following along online on our website they will be able to see even more videos, stories and maps linking each clip and picture to the communities where they were taken. 

Your Support 

The Thank you Canada story is more than each and every one of us, it inspires us to do bigger things, it is a chance to live on for forever in the hearts of future Canadians. This is why we believe in Thank you Canada, it is why last year alone we donated over $50,000 to this project in order to fund our expeditions. It's because we don't want the Canada we live in today to be lost in the future. 

The funds raised by this campaign will go to funding our next expedition across Canada during the autumn and winter of 2017; it will enable us to stay on the road. If we don't reach that goal your contribution will not go to waste, we are committed to finishing this once in a lifetime project and we will against all odds continue doing just that.

Through years of planning and logistical work we have managed to gain support and create long lasting partnerships with destination across Canada. This enables us not only to see places which very few people get to see, but also to travel to the inaccessible destinations in Canada on a very tight budget. 

Thank you!

We are very grateful for any contributions that we can get, but if you can't fund the campaign no problem! Thank you Canada is much bigger than any one person, it is built on individuals like yourself and we invite you to join our journey. Follow along on  Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram share our story and our campaign to keep us moving forward. Like us, Follow us, See us!

We invite you not just to follow along, but share with us your favourite destination and we will add it to our next expedition. Join the Thank you Canada expedition and create a gift for our children and grandchildren.

We are living in a rapidly evolving society where our day to day lives do not always allow us enough time pause and think about the past or the future. What will we tell our great-grandchildren if they ask us about our country and our life in 2017? Look back at our own history and Canada's 100th anniversary in 1967, is there anything that we can easily share today about this country and its people just 50 years ago?

story:
Short Summary

“The stories people tell have a way of taking care of them. If stories come to you, care for them. And learn to give them away where they are needed. Sometimes a person needs a story more than food to stay alive. That is why we put these stories in each other's memories. This is how people care for themselves.”

― Barry López, Crow and Weasel

 

Not Our Status But Our Stories will bring forth the concept of Ubuntu, [...] A person with Ubuntu is open and available to others, affirming of others, does not feel threatened that others are able and good, for he or she has a proper self-assurance that comes from knowing that he or she belongs in a greater whole and is diminished when others are humiliated or diminished, when others are tortured or oppressed, or treated as if they were less than who they are.” With the self-publishing of;

 

Sistah’s Speak (voices of HIV positive women) is the working title for a collection of short fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, personal narratives, critical essays and visual art from women living with HIV/AIDS. This project seeks to create a space for women to share their stories in their own voice sharing with an opens heart as a vehicle for chronicling your lives. The goal of this project is to empower, supports the soul and uplifts the spirit of women people living with HIV/AIDS. This collection women who are HIV positive share themes of dating, intimate partner violence, reproductive rights, disclosure, who will care for my child if I die, speaking openly about living with HIV, addiction and recovery, loss of relationships and many other issues women face.

 

Raising Kazembe: A Memoir This collection of journal letter written by an HIV positive father to his son. It chronicles the lesson of life and education, the mental and emotional health of a father who deals with isolation, stigma, mental health issues as well as how the traumas of his childhood played out in his parenting and desire to heal. These letters, Khafre began writing to is then unborn child in 1992, because he did not believe he would live long enough to witness his child grow to adulthood. Khafre wanted his son to know from his own voice. His letters share with is son, Kazembe the reality of living with HIV, the fear of dying,  sexuality, decisions regarding medical care, disclosure and much more.

 

The goal of Not Our Status But Our Stories is to self-publish to new contributions to AIDS literary history. To bring forth voices, stories and books from often marginalized communities which is inclusive of genre, gender, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability. Working in the spirit of Ubuntu, Not Our Status But Our Stories, this work seeks highlight these voices, “Ubuntu [...] speaks of the very essence of being human. [We] say [...] "Hey, so-and-so has Ubuntu." Then you are generous, you are hospitable, you are friendly and caring and compassionate. You share what you have. It is to say, "My humanity is caught up, is inextricably bound up, in yours." We belong in a bundle of life. We say, "A person is a person through other persons."

 

What We Need & What You Get

Through your support and participation in this campaign we can work together to put in place sustainable programs that will increase diversity among publishing staffs in the long-term. Together, we can create a more inclusive book publishing industry.

Resources to self- publish Sistah’s Speak and Raising Kazembe: A Memoir

All-in Branding Package, Custom Logo Design Package, a color palette, typography palette, a Stationery Design Package, a Landing Page Design Package, Blog Design Package, with the inclusion of:

Digital Formatting and Distribution (e-Book)

Paperback Publishing

Hardcover Publishing

Cover Interior customization

Image Insertions

Electronic Proof

One-on-one author support

Online distribution thru Amazon, Barnes & Noble and other book retailers

ISBN assignment

US copyright

Library of Congress Control Number

Google Preview

Book Buyer’s Preview

Promotional materials

 

The Impact

“There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.”

― Maya Angelou, I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

 

I have asked myself this question. “How can I use my position, knowledge of publishing, writing, editing, and sharing stories to help create additional contributions to the literary world that is diverse, equitable, and doesn’t just represent the same segment of society it always has since its inception? What concrete actions can I take to make actual change and move beyond the tired conversation we’ve been having for decades about the lack of diversity in publishing?”

 

“Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”

― Neil Gaiman, M Is for Magi

 

Continuing my efforts in self-publishing stories and voices of people living with HIV was the answer. Yours support will allow Not Our Status But Our Stories to speak the voices and stories of those under- represented in publishing. Together will be allow the stories and history of our collective community to be told.

 

The Impact of Not Out Status But Our Stories will create and build community through publishing where, “A person is a person through other people' strikes an affirmation of one’s humanity through recognition of an ‘other’ in his or her uniqueness and difference. It is a demand for a creative inter-subjective formation in which the ‘other’ becomes a mirror (but only a mirror) for my subjectivity. This idealism suggests to us that humanity is not embedded in my person solely as an individual; my humanity is co-substantively bestowed upon the other and me. Humanity is a quality we owe to each other. We create each other and need to sustain this otherness creation. And if we belong to each other, we participate in our creations: we are because you are, and since you are, I am. The ‘I am’ is not a rigid subject, but a dynamic self-constitution dependent on this otherness creation of relation and distance”.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Challenge five of your friends to support this campaign, post this campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, and log on the campaign link to post comments.  Spread the word about this project and share it on Twitter so we can raise the GoGo Factor for this project.  Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

story:
Short Summary

Princess Aila (pronounced Eye-lah) is the only child of Scotland's King Fergus back when unicorns roamed the forests of Scotland.  The meaning of Aila is “from a strong or resilient place”. This meaning paints the picture of a girl that will grow to be a leader and one that does not back down from a challenge.

Aila has a gift, she can speak the languages of many animals.  This classic tale will delight readers both young and old.  It is a story which speaks to respecting all life, a story of bravery, a story of honesty and a story of love.  

I was handed this story from a visitor in my dream, I had no choice but to let the story be told.

What You Get

The story is being published and printed through BookLocker.  Everything is in progress and sometime in 2019 anyone will be able to purchase a copy from the website I am building, or from BookLocker or pretty much any retailer as it will be registered with Ingram.  To celebrate I am going to order my first copy and will happily put your pre-order in with mine.  You will get a hardcover first edition copy of the book, numbered and signed by me.  You will also get it for about  20% less than retail.  And I will deliver or ship it to you.  But you have to make your order before December 8!

The Impact

You, or your students, your child or your grandchildren will love this story. It is a classic story about bravery, about being honest, having integrity and most of all it is a story about  unicorns and love.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks, other than I will most likely not be able to get this printed before Christmas.  Let's call it a great way to start the new year!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the video and share it again.  Share it with every social media you know how to use!

story:
LØPE MAGAZINE

The premise of Løpe Magazine simple: Each month, we will publish one eye-opening feature story (longform for those who like the word). For $20 per year, subscribers will have access to 12 in-depth stories per year. 

Liam Boylan-Pett, a sub-four-minute miler turned writer and editor, is the magazine's founder. He will write and/or edit every story that goes on the site. He is working with some of the industry's best writers and editors to build a website that takes coverage of track and field to a new level. 

Løpe Magazine launched in mid-June with the release of "The History of the United States According to the Steeplechase," and will be resuming in earnest in September with a story from one of the world's most famous one-mile road races. In the time between, we're asking for your help: The more subscribers, the more content we will be able to produce. By contributing to Løpe Magazine, each month will bring another story you do not want to put down. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of the bare bones budget needed to get Løpe Magazine off the ground. 

  • The goal is to raise $20,000. Here's a breakdown of where that money will go
    • $1,000 to $2,000 paid to writers for each story 
    • $500 paid to illustrators/for photography
    • $500 to $1,000 paid to editors/copy editors per story
    • $2,000 for miscellaneous fees, including web hosting and travel
    • You can get to $20,000 in a lot of different ways with those numbers, and hopefully we end up with a budget higher than that...but we will make whatever we get work! 
  • If you contribute through this IndieGoGo, you'll have an opportunity to pick up Løpe Magazine merchandise, including singlets, mugs, and laptop stickers. Plus, the more contributors, the more opportunities for more in-depth stories and more coverage of track and field. 
  • Whether we reach our desired goal or not will not change the trajectory of Løpe Magazine--we will work within the budget to create the best running magazine we can. .

Share

If you can't contribute, read and share our stories. Head over to www.lopemagazine.com to read our first issue and be on the lookout for more information and stories in the lead-up to the magazine's full launch in September.

story:
Boek: Er was eens een olifant
Geschreven door Helmi Verbakel, met illustraties van Mirjam Stam

Niet zo heel lang geleden stond Helmi voor Mirjam's deur. Op zich niets vreemds - dat gebeurt vaker. Maar nu had ze een vraag. Ze had een verhaal geschreven en vroeg Mirjam of zij zin had om er iets moois van te maken met haar talent voor illustreren en vormgeving. Dat wilde Mirjam wel!

We hebben er heel hard en met heel veel plezier aan gewerkt (en het is bijna klaar). We hebben het elke dag een beetje mooier zien worden - en zelf worden we er elke dag een beetje blijer van. 

We zijn nu bezig met de laatste puntjes op de 'i'. We gaan het boek zelf uitgeven en zijn daarom deze crowdfundingscampagne gestart. Wil je ons helpen het boek te publiceren? Super fijn!

Er zijn meerdere manieren om ons te steunen. 

Wil je zelf kiezen welk bedrag je doneert,  klik dan op de button BACK IT en vul het bedrag in. 

Of kies uit een van de 'perks' en ontvang in ruil voor je donatie ons boek, een set ansichtkaarten van de olifant, of een combinatie hiervan.

Wil je ons graag steunen, maar kom je er op deze site niet helemaal uit of doe je niet aan internetbankieren? Je kunt altijd contact met ons opnemen. 

Wat anderen zeggen over ons boek:

"Een must-read voor alle onderwijsmensen, papa's, mama's en andere mensen van nu."

"Ik heb al een kijkje mogen nemen en kan niet wachten tot het klaar is. Aanrader voor iedereen die met mensen omgaat. Want kan niet iedereen, groot en klein, alleen maar gelukkig worden als je je leven in vrijheid samen met anderen kunt leven?"

"Prentenboeken voor volwassenen: voor mij mogen die er meer komen."

Nederlandstalig - 36 pagina's - afmeting 18x18 cm - hardcover

Op zich niets vreemds - dat gebeurt vaker. Maar nu had ze een vraag. Ze had een verhaal geschreven en vroeg Mirjam of zij zin had om er iets moois van te maken met haar talent voor illustreren en vormgeving. Dat wilde Mirjam wel!We hebben er heel hard en met heel veel plezier aan gewerkt (en het is bijna klaar). We hebben het elke dag een beetje mooier zien worden - en zelf worden we er elke dag een beetje blijer van. We zijn nu bezig met de laatste puntjes op de 'i'. We gaan het boek zelf uitgeven en zijn daarom deze crowdfundingscampagne gestart. Wil je ons helpen het boek te publiceren? Super fijn!Er zijn meerdere manieren om ons te steunen. Wil je zelf kiezen welk bedrag je doneert,  klik dan op de button BACK IT en vul het bedrag in. Of kies uit een van de 'perks' en ontvang in ruil voor je donatie ons boek, een set ansichtkaarten van de olifant, of een combinatie hiervan.Wil je ons graag steunen, maar kom je er op deze site niet helemaal uit of doe je niet aan internetbankieren? story:
Our Story

After seven years of baking homemade treats for Maeby, we are sharing our story and our favorite dessert recipes with you! This is the first book designed so that you can make a dog friendly version of your dessert or so that you can make a people pleasing version of your dog’s treat! 

**Pre-order the 1st Edition of Maeby & Me now by contributing $30 or more!** (Expected release: December 2020)

BACKSTORY
In 2013, I adopted an incredibly sweet puppy who I named Maeby. Our first walk was a funny encounter of us trying to observe each other, but there was an instant connection. Since that day, we’ve had so many great adventures.

Because I am “that” dog lady, I used my love for baking to spoil Maeby on her birthdays and gotcha days. It’s been a 7 year tradition of baking some seriously special treats that she and I have both enjoyed. And last year, I realized I had enough recipes to write a book, so here we are!

You’ll hopefully notice from our photos and the bakes themselves that spending time in the kitchen with your pup is really all about having fun with your furry friend. Maeby spoils me every day with her love and affection, so it’s nice every now and again to demonstrate how much she means to me by whipping up some fresh treats just for her.


Who Is This For?

This book makes a great gift for all those dog lovers! Our release is planned for December 2020 - just in the time for the holidays! Most recipes are beginner or intermediate level, so don't worry about your baking skills. The best part about baking for your dog is that your pup will love it even if it's not quite perfect.

Each recipe is designed so that there are clearly marked dog friendly recipes ("For Maeby") and human recipes ("For Me"). The recipe below is a preview of what to expect. (Receive an advanced digital copy of 1 recipe with a contribution of $15 or more.)


What We Need

At this time, the book is about 90% finished, with only a few more stories to write and recipes to test. However, with the goal of delivering these to our supporters, dog lovers, and bakers by the holidays, we need pre-orders to help finance the initial order of books.

The goal of $7,500 will cover the down payment required to print an initial order at a higher quality than simply printing "on-demand". In the event that we can raise more than $7,500, funds will be put towards the outstanding payment required by my printer. In the event that we do not reach $7,500 or general interest is low, we may resort to an on-demand printer/distributor. 

SPREAD THE WORD!
For those of you that can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help! We'd love it if you could help spread the word. Please feel free to share this page and/or follow us on Instagram @maebyandmecookbook. 


The Team

Over the course of the past year and a half, one of my oldest and closest childhood friends Nick Holmes has been spending long weekends traveling back and forth between Chicago and New York City with me to bring this to life. A professional food photographer and graphic designer, Nick's expertise, coupled with my concept (and our designated tie breaker Simon Morgan) have helped propel this project forward.
 


MAEBY | Inspiration/Treat Tester
A seven year old terrier mix, Maeby hails from the streets of Houston, TX. Adopted by Jen Augello in 2013, Maeby has inspired people all over the world to be kind and love dogs. She enjoys the beach, agility class, "coming with", and testing all homemade dog treats, especially those including cheese.
 


JEN AUGELLO | Author/Creator
A clarinetist, producer, and consultant, Jen usually spends much of her time with Maeby working with Sesame Workshop as the production manager of Sesame Street and The Not-Too-Late Show with Elmo and serves as the Director of Operations for Tertulia Chamber Music.  Based in New York City, Jen also loves baking, spending time with Maeby, and traveling.
 


NICK HOLMES | Photographer/Designer
Nick is a Chicago-based graphic designer with Antlur Creative who has worked with national brands and now has a strange obsession with food photography. (We think he’s just always hungry.) See more of Nick’s work at antlur.co and nickdoesfood.com.


Rewards

(Add additional copies of Maeby & Me to your perk at checkout.)

$15 - The Quick Sniff: 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$30 - The Pawfect Treat: 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me (hardcover) + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$45 - Maeby Unleashed:  1st edition copy of Maeby & Me (hardcover and ebook) + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$55 - Limited Edition Early Backer Baker: Signed 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me (hardcover) + 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me ebook + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$90 - Friends & Family Pack: Three (3) 1st edition copies of Maeby & Me (hardcover) + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$120 - VIP Pup Pass: Invitation to cooking demo with Maeby +  Two (2) signed 1st edition copies of Maeby & Me (hardcover) + 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me ebook + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe

$195 - Platinum Paws: Recognition in the 1st edition of Maeby & Me + Invitation to cooking demo with Maeby + Signed 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me (hardcover) + 1st edition copy of Maeby & Me ebook + 1 digital advanced copy of one recipe


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!
For those of you that can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help! We'd love it if you could help spread the word. Please feel free to share this page and/or follow us on Instagram @maebyandmecookbook. 

PARTNERSHIPS
Eventually, I'm hoping to get some advanced copies to local dog stores, cafes, and potentially create a partnership with another brand, but that is all still in the works. If you know anyone that might be interested in forming a partnership, please feel free to reach out. You can contact me through my website: maebyandme.com
