story:
A DWELLING PLACE FOR CHILDLESS WOMEN IN EVERY SEASON

We are on a journey to create a trailblazing magazine for and by childless women shaping our society and culture, while helping women throughout the world cope through and beyond childlessness. 

Despite the fact that approximately 1 in 5 women will remain childless—and for 90% of them, it was not by choice—there’s still a lack of representation of the perspectives and lives of involuntarily childless women in publications and media. 

Tutum Journal is a digital quarterly magazine that will further our mission to own our voice, control our narrative, shift perspectives and stigmas and deepen understandings to help women move from distress to fulfillment, helping them make deeper connection with like-minded women creating their own happiness and power in the world.

Tutum Journal builds self-recovery, develops sisterhood and provides a safe space to be seen and heard. Literally, the name suggests a safe space, as the Latin word “tutum” can be defined as “safe.” Each magazine issue is a “big topic” guide, exploring many aspects of a theme that’s vitally important to the childless community. This is more than a magazine; it is a community. A conversation. A childless woman will always find herself  in our pages. This magazine belongs to us!

As our media platform, Tutum Global grows, here are samples of coping and well-being tips on our website.

And, here are samples of more stories we want to share, unique to the childless experience, such as As Told By Childless Women series, Watch it below – and help us tell these stories.

     

     

 

Who am I and why am I creating Tutum Journal?

Hi, I’m Jobi Tyson. At 40 years of age, I found myself at the end of my 20-year unexplained infertility journey as I was advised to get a hysterectomy. I felt alone, and stuck in a mid-life rut. After I went on a year-long quest to research the root cause of my infertility, I inadvertently found research-based strategies to better cope with permanent childlessness.

So, then I founded Tutum Global to provide a helping hand and inspiration to all those women out there feeling like they cannot cope and live beyond their childless state. Before that, I was an advertising agency executive for over 20 years. In working with major brands, I've helped launch magazines and campaigns for countless clients. However, in all of these industries, I felt the gravity of the under-representation and exclusion of childless women. I saw there was something missing in magazines because media companies, and even brands don’t really reach us – they don’t speak to us. We typically don’t feel like the way they share content sounds like how we spoke about the different issues in our lives.

Over the years, I’ve earned a master’s degree in business administration, trained in cognitive behavioral therapy, sociocultural research and journalism, gained multimedia expertise, and learned the crafts of photography and web programming. My heart’s desire has been to launch a purposeful publication. And the time has come! Funding Tutum Journal is helping other childless women to find out their deeper purpose and begin their journey of self-discovery.

As the Editor-in-Chief of our highly anticipated digital magazine, Tutum Journal, and on behalf of our talented editorial team: Brandi Lytle of popular blog, NotSoMommy.com, Anita Henderson of Write Your Life, and former niche magazine editor-in-chief, and Charlotte Bishop of MRKH Connect; we’re all so grateful for your support, and even more excited about what we’re going to build together.

Just because I’m grateful that you're here, click here to download a free positive affirmations wallpaper for your smartphone.

But, a publication showcasing childless women is VITAL. Our community is incredible. Our movement is massive. And this is just the beginning.

 

With deepest gratitude,

Jobi Tyson

We are thrilled about the launch of Tutum Journal, and we hope you are, too.

Please help us reach our goal of $8,500!

What is the funding for?

We're looking to Indiegogo, one the top crowdfunding sites to help us get our magazine off the ground. Crowdfunding the full amount of $8,500 will deliver the magazine launch in early spring 2021 and your support will allow us to:

  • Design and content production of magazine on website
  • Set up website
  • Marketing and launch of the magazine, including cost of advertising
  • Design and produce the media kit
  • File legal documents 
  • Compensate childless female writers, staff, designers, and photographers for their time and expertise

Tutum Journal belongs to our community. With each dollar sown, your fingerprint will intricately be woven throughout this magazine, figuratively and visibly. 

If you want to contribute without a perk, you can click Back It link to top right of page or scroll to donate without perk.

Partner With Us

  • If you’re a new or seasoned writer with a story to pitch, or if you are a designer, editor, photographer or advertising sales professional;
  • If you are a childless woman that owns at least 51% of a company and want to be included in our online directory;
  • If you’re a business that supports the interests of childless women and want to advertise with us, a foundation that wants to support us, or someone who wants to make a particularly generous contribution;
  • If you’re a reporter or blogger who wants to interview;
  • Or, you have any other questions or comments, email: info@tutumglobal.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Via PayPal ---> Click here
  • Via CashApp ---> Click here
  • Purchase positive affirmation t-shirts, hoodies, mugs and face masks. Visit tutumstore.com.

 

 We recognize some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't HELP:

We need you to make some noise about our campaign. Send a private message to those who you think will invest. As we connect with those in our community, we humbly ask that you send this to just three people in your community who have the means to make our magazine happen.

We need you to be our biggest cheerleaders! Not only share this campaign but Tweet about us, post about us on Facebook and Instagram, get people to follow us. We want engaged followers!

Speaking of engaged followers, do you follow us on Instagram and Facebook?

 

Click here to join our email list to stay informed.

story:
Hi everyone, my name is Jerry Frye and I am the author of the new educational marijuana storybook, Cannabis The Cat To The Rescue. I grew up with Smokey the Bear and Woodsy Owl. These characters taught me fire safety, forest preservation, and how to respect our natural resources. The world is filled with natural remedies and marijuana is one of them.

     It is important now more than ever, that we have someone who will teach us about marijuana, Someone we can trust, and someone we can learn from. That someone is Cannabis The Cat. An emerald-colored kitty who responds to marijuana emergencies in the nick of time.

     In the story when someone has a cannabis emergency they dial 4-2-0. Cannabis The Cat answers the call from his 420 watch and responds on his flying magic Carpet made out of the finest hemp plants. Cannabis helps a young girl with her CBD oil. Cannabis The Cat helps an army veteran get safe relief from his PTSD. Cannabis even helps a teenager with peer pressure about weed.

     I recently finished this 34-page full-color educational picture book. Along with a fun coloring book. Plus some great rewards. I have a Cannabis The Cat plush toy prototype and the money raised from this campaign will bring the Cannabis The Cat plush toy to life. I also have cat pens, air fresheners, pocket mirrors, and other great products as well.

Please reach out if you have any questions.   Check out CannabisTheCat.com     

Thank you for your interest. Please share and support Cannabis The Cat.

And remember, "You don't have to use marijuana to love Cannabis The Cat!

story:
Short Summary

TheSophiaMag.com is the brainchild of Madge Madigan and Barb McSpadden. Sophia was conceived by immaculate conception from these two after realizing there were no magazines out their that appeal to clever, witty, intelligent adults (mostly women) who don't care about getting thinner thighs or fashion items that wouldn't fit a grown adult.

* Barb is a design wiz and has over 20 years of marketing experience and about 10 years in the magazine biz.

* Madge is a single mom of 3 kids now in college and post grad. She has over 20 years marketing experience and 5 years in the magazine biz.

We hope to bring incredibly interesting and inspiring articles and images to folks to educate and make you laugh. There is so much crap out there that just reinforces the shallow and divisive climate we are living in now. Your contribution can help us continue on our mission!

What We Need and What You Get

We need $5,000 (but could use more) for:

* Website upgrade and hosting

* Legal mumbo jumbo... create contracts, an LLC, and the like.

* Funds to start paying freelance writers.

* Marketing

* To create platforms to have webinars

We have awesome perks! Like Sophia T-shirts, pop sockets, launch party VIP invites, and incredibly advertising packages!

Break it down for folks in more detail:

The Impact

Please take a look at Thesophiamag.com for a taste of things to come. We think we have some powerful thought-provoking items that will change the way you think.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously we need advertisers and supporters to stay afloat. And it takes more writers to continue providing awesome content. Madge and Barb can't write the whole thing themselves, nor would we want them to, we love new and different perspectives!

But we can overcome this with a little boost from you all! We will work our asses off but we just need a little jump start with the funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Anyone can help by...

Short Summary
TheSophiaMag.com is the brainchild of Madge Madigan and Barb McSpadden. Sophia was conceived by immaculate conception from these two after realizing there were no magazines out their that appeal to clever, witty, intelligent adults (mostly women) who don't care about getting thinner thighs or fashion items that wouldn't fit a grown adult.
* Barb is a design wiz and has over 20 years of marketing experience and about 10 years in the magazine biz.
* Madge is a single mom of 3 kids now in college and post grad. She has over 20 years marketing experience and 5 years in the magazine biz.
We hope to bring incredibly interesting and inspiring articles and images to folks to educate and make you laugh. There is so much crap out there that just reinforces the shallow and divisive climate we are living in now. Your contribution can help us continue on our mission!
What We Need and What You Get

We need $5,000 (but could use more) for:
* Website upgrade and hosting
* Legal mumbo jumbo... create contracts, an LLC, and the like.
* Funds to start paying freelance writers.
* Marketing
* To create platforms to have webinars
We have awesome perks! Like Sophia T-shirts, pop sockets, launch party VIP invites, and incredibly advertising packages!
Break it down for folks in more detail:

The Impact
Please take a look at Thesophiamag.com for a taste of things to come. We think we have some powerful thought-provoking items that will change the way you think.

Risks & Challenges
Obviously we need advertisers and supporters to stay afloat. And it takes more writers to continue providing awesome content. Madge and Barb can't write the whole thing themselves, nor would we want them to, we love new and different perspectives!
But we can overcome this with a little boost from you all! We will work our asses off but we just need a little jump start with the funds.
Other Ways You Can Help

We realize some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Anyone can help by...

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! You can share the link to this campaign on your social media.
And get the word out about Sophia! Please share our articles on your social media.

Let's do this! We love our readers!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Claude Alick, born on the island of Grenada. I'm the author of a collection of short stories, WET STORAGE AND OTHER STORIES and a novel, DANCING WITH THE YUMAWALLI and a play about Haiti, COWARDICE OF EYES, financed through Indiegogo. I wrote, produced and acted in the play. I'll never take on that much work again. That was a Bucket-list endeavor. This new project, ONCE ON THE ISLE OF SPICE is a labor of love, an ode to the island of Grenada, Grenadians of the past and an attempt to showcase our folklore, our history, and the magic of this gem, and her people to the rest of the world. Your contribution will help me to achieve this goal.

        Looking backward to look forward

I think some of the people of Grenada, as the old folks die off, have forgotten their past. This is an attempt to remind them of where they came from and what the future might hold, how history, mythology, and religion influence their lives. You can help me to deliver this message and enlighten a new generation.

     What I Need & What You Get

The funding from this campaign will go exclusively toward marketing this project to a wider audience, hiring a professional publicist to assist with navigating the maze of social and traditional media, connecting with blogs featuring interviews and reviews of authors and their books. For your contribution, you will receive a variety of spices and teas from Grenada, nutmeg, clove, cinnamon, turmeric and more, hermetically sealed and approved by the FDA. Not reaching my entire goal will be no hindrance. The foundation for this project is already in place. Your contribution toward the marketing will be extremely helpful. Funds for the editing and production of the book is already secured and deployed toward the production of the book.

      The Impact of history

In the early eighties, the might of the United States military descended of the island of Grenada to oust a group of politicians who thought they could do more for the people of Grenada than the ones who ruled prior to the coup to seize power. I think it's important for people to understand the details of colonialism, and how that history led to that conflict, why the most powerful country in the world attacked one of the weakest. My research before writing the play, COWARDICE OF EYES and successfully producing it, with funds secured through IndieGoGo, has endowed me with a deep knowledge of the history and politics of the Caribbean.

             Risks & Challenges

I see no risk or challenges in completing this project. I suppose no one can be 100% sure about anything. But for where I stand, I would say this should be smooth sailing with your contribution to this campaign and a little help with spreading the word about the existence of the novel, ONCE ON THE ISLE OF SPICE.

   Other Ways You Can Help

I know that money can be hard to come by these days. If that's the case, you can contribute in other ways: Share on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, through WOM (word of mouth), telling your friends and relatives about my campaign and what it will help to accomplish. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

story:
Could improved communication and understanding help us resolve problems in our world?

The purpose of The Enlightened Worldview Project (EWP) is to promote peace in society through teaching effective communication techniques, even between people who hold outrageously opposing viewpoints. Currently, there’s too much unnecessary conflict and suffering in this world, but The Enlightened Worldview Project seeks to help resolve this through a new book, Seeking a More Enlightened Worldview.

The book digs into the root causes of unnecessary conflict and suffering and explains how to combat this lack of mutual understanding, agreement, and cooperation. This book is a sort of manual that provides practical solutions such as improved communication, which is designed to help individuals break free of their tribal, nationalistic, and partisan instincts. The effective techniques outline new methods of dialogue that can bridge this great divide and inspire a more peaceful and prosperous society. 

Although this campaign is specifically for our first book, the end goal is to produce an entire content series of books, podcasts, and videos that educate and inspire people to promote societal understanding and inner awareness, with the ultimate aim of working toward conflict avoidance and greater peace.

This Book will Help You:

  • Improve self-awareness and mindfulness
  • Express your thoughts and feelings better
  • Understand other people's thoughts and feelings at a deeper level
  • Sort out fact from fiction amidst the constant bombardment of information
  • Identify shared core values, even among people who come from different walks of life
  • Reduce conflict in your world and find greater inner and outer peace in your life

Book Outline

  •  Part 1: Are there Solutions to the Most Serious Problems in Our World?  -  Explains how the root cause of our most serious problems is lack of effective communication and understanding.  We can’t convey our thoughts and feelings to other people and we also don’t understand other people’s thoughts and feelings.
  •  Part 2: Building the Structure of Knowledge – To bridge this divide, we start by focusing on sensemaking, including the basics of how knowledge is developed, and how science works.  We also need to be able to sort out fact from fiction, since we're constantly being bombarded with information, not all of which is true.
  • Part 3: A Science for Where the Mind Meets the Social Landscape – We introduce a new way of developing inner awareness and mindfulness and we show how this can be brought together with other sciences in order to recognize that all people have certain core values in common. This realization can then be used to improve communication and mutual understanding and lead to conflict avoidance and the promotion of peace.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising funds to be able to pay for professional editing for the book and to be able to publish it.  We feel a total of $5000 will allow us to produce a highly professional book.  You can pre-order this book for as little as $10.  All reward levels include some version of this book, once it is completed and published.

About the Author

Brandon Norgaard is the creator and founder of The Enlightened Worldview Project and the  primary author of this book. Brandon has always possessed an interest in understanding how things work and appreciated learning about philosophy, religion, history, politics, science, and technology.  Throughout his life, Brandon wanted to better understand why there is so much conflict and injustice in our world and what, if anything, people can do to work toward greater peace.

The Future

Eventually we plan to release additional volumes in this book series, which will cover more details about how we can understand consciousness, the self, core values, and the practical application that such realizations would have to socio-political matters and large-scale conflict resolution and peace initiatives. We are also looking to found a nonprofit organization, and if we exceed our goal by a significant amount, we will use some of the revenue for the initial costs associated with the creation of this organization.

Risks and challenges

This is an ambitious project and there are risks and challenges. The biggest challenge is staying on schedule and completing the work by the set deadlines with the highest level of professionalism and attention to details. Another challenge is producing a final product that has the optimal balance of educational and entertainment value so that it does have a tangible, positive impact and is also understandable and relatable to a broad audience. The greatest risks are that we might fall behind schedule or over budget. Our team has experience writing and publishing books and producing podcasts within budget and we have an excellent track record of meeting production deadlines and in producing high-quality work that is both interesting and educational.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Visit EnlightenedWorldview.com and read the blog, register with the forum and join the conversation
  • Share this campaign to your friends
  • Share the featured video to your friends
  • Recommend that author Brandon Norgaard be interviewed by your favorite podcast or online platform

story:
Our story

Notes from Poland has for the last four years been produced by two academic colleagues: Stanley Bill, director of the Polish Studies Programme at the University of Cambridge, and Daniel Tilles, an assistant professor at the Pedagogical University of Kraków. We provide regular summaries of news from Poland, along with the insights, context and background necessary to make sense of what is happening here.

This has seen us become the most popular and trusted source of English-language news about Poland on social media, with almost 35,000 followers on Facebook and over 10,000 on Twitter. Our reporting and insights have featured in a range of international media, including the BBC, Foreign Policy and the Financial Times.

Our plans

There has never been a more important time to understand Poland and, as our success so far shows, there is growing international interest in a country that is increasingly prominent on the European and world stage.

Yet Poland’s rise has not been matched by a similar improvement in reliable English-language reporting on the country. Existing English news services dedicated to Poland are linked to the Polish state, meaning that their content reflects the government’s interests. Coverage of Poland in international media is sporadic and not always reliable due to a lack of investment in permanent reporters in the country.

This is a problem we have already sought to address. But to truly make a difference we need to move beyond social media and establish a more substantial web presence. We intend to re-launch Notes from Poland with a new website, offering comprehensive coverage of Polish current affairs, society, culture and history, as well as regular analysis and opinion from a wide range of expert authors. Over time, and depending on the funds we raise, we hope to add podcasts, a newsletter and videos, as well as to organise public events.

To achieve this, we have established a non-profit foundation in Poland that will be responsible for Notes from Poland. It is led by an experienced and dynamic board, whose work is supervised by an oversight committee and supported by an advisory panel made up of prominent figures from the worlds of culture, media and academia (see below).

Why we need your support

Achieving these aims requires resources. Until now, all of our activity has been grassroots and voluntary. We have received no funding and generated no revenue. But to go beyond social media we need to make a significant initial investment and then require further funds to maintain and expand our work as we take on the staffing, technical and other costs associated with producing high-quality media content.

Raising this money with the support of our readers will also help us to preserve the independence that has characterised our work so far. Moreover, it will allow us to continue making our content available to everyone interested in Poland, without any paywalls.

Perhaps you are one of our long-time followers who appreciates the work we have done and wants to help us take it further. Or perhaps you are discovering us for the first time but recognise the need for objective, reliable and informed reporting on Poland. Whatever the case, we hope that you can support us as we take these next steps.

Finally, because we operate as a non-profit foundation, bound by the provisions of Polish law on such entities, you can be assured that every cent, penny or grosz you are able to provide us with will be invested directly into Notes from Poland, to cover the costs necessary to move forward with our plans.

Endorsements

Norman Davies: "Accurate, up-to-date and authoritative information on Poland in English is everywhere in short supply. Notes from Poland exactly fit the bill."

Olga Tokarczuk: "Reliable and objective information about Poland is needed today like never before. It is good that Notes from Poland is being created."

Timothy Garton Ash: "Notes from Poland has rapidly become an indispensable resource for those interested in independent, high-quality information and analysis on contemporary Poland."

Our team

Details of the nonprofit Notes from Poland Foundation, as recorded in Poland's National Court Register (KRS), can be found here.

Executive board

Stanley Bill (chair)

Senior Lecturer at the University of Cambridge and Director of its Polish Studies Programme

Katarzyna Zielińska (deputy chair)

Associate Professor at the Institute of Sociology of the Jagiellonian University, Kraków

Daniel Tilles (editor-in-chief)

Assistant Professor of History at the Pedagogical University of Kraków

Adam Reichardt

Editor-in-chief of New Eastern Europe

Advisory committee

Norman Davies (senior consultant)

UNESCO Professor at the Jagiellonian University and Professor Emeritus at University College London

Olga Tokarczuk

Author, winner of 2018 Man Booker International Prize

Timothy Garton Ash

Professor of European Studies at Oxford University

Andrzej Nowak

Professor at the Institute of History of the Jagiellonian University

Paweł Kowal

Associate Professor at the Institute of Political Studies of the Polish Academy of Science, former member of the Polish and European Parliaments, 

Shana Penn

Executive Director of Taube Family Foundation

Agata Gostyńska-Jakubowska

Senior Research Fellow at the Centre for European Reform

Oversight committee

Karolina Czerska-Shaw (chair)

Assistant Professor at the Institute of European Studies of the Jagiellonian University.

Jonathan Ornstein

Executive Director of JCC Kraków

Roma Sendyka

Assistant Professor at the Department of Anthropolgy of Literature and Cultural Research of the Jagiellonian University 

Kinga Stoszek

Chief Specialist, Kraków Mayor's Office

story:
The Life & Legacy of Cyrus The Great

Cyrus created the largest empire the world had ever seen, The Persian Empire –– stretching across Asia, the Middle East, Europe and even parts of Africa. After conquering the Median Empire and the Lydian Empire in 550 B.C., Cyrus went on to conquer Babylon, he freed the Jews from captivity and helped them to return to Jerusalem. He proclaimed the First Charter of Human Rights 2500 years ago. He heavily influenced great leaders like Thomas Jefferson and writing of US Constitution. His message of Human Rights, Diversity and respect for human dignity and freedom is still relevant today.
 

Our book, Cyrus The Rise of Empire is based on a film script we have written to make an epic historical movie.  In the tradition of epic films like Gladiator, Braveheart, Ben-Hur, and the Ten Commandments, Cyrus the Great is an incredible retelling of one of the most extraordinary men who ever lived.​ We believe more people should be aware of his story and what he did for history. 

The Story

Twenty-five hundred years ago, Cyrus the Great, a leader of wisdom and virtue and enduring influence, created the Persian Empire, conquered Babylon, freed the Jews from captivity, formulated mankind’s first human rights charter, ruled over those he conquered with respect and benevolence, and changed the course of world history. A fast-paced drama of the life of Cyrus the Great that begins when he is kidnapped at birth because of prophecy, and left to die in the wilderness. The beginnings of a heroic warrior destined to become the founder of an empire that would stretch from Africa and Egypt to India.  Cyrus: The Rise of Empire is an epic retelling of one of the most extraordinary men who ever lived.

story:
My story to Almost Fearless

At the age of 19, I stepped through a wall of fear in my life and became a small business owner. Little did I know, it would open up my life to fully exposing myself for who I am;  a leader, healer and psychic with a passion for creating safe and supportive space for others to learn and grow into their own gifts. 

I have found that no matter who we are, we are all bound together in a fear-based society. Each of us carries our own fears and many of us are conditioned to live in fear of being different or the fear of walking alone on our journey. 

Whether the journey involves psychic gifts or a fear of public speaking, none of us deserves to walk it alone. In A Life Lived Medium: A Psychic's Journey from Fearful to Almost Fearless I show my vulnerability so that others are inspired and encouraged to walk an almost fearless life by embracing their gifts and their differences as well. My goal is to lead by example by putting myself out there with this memoir. I stepped through my fear so that, hopefully, others will do the same. 

 

How can you help? What will you receive? 

The funding received from this campaign will be used to pay for the printing and marketing of my memoir. The costs associated with publishing my book included; paying the consulting fees for my publishing, hiring an editor, proof reader, marketing director, cover designer, creating my author website, printing of the initial run of A Life Lived Medium books and printing and design of the Moments of Clarity Journal.  

 

Have your ears PERKed up yet? 

There are 11 levels of perks offered on this campaign. That means that there is something for everyone! 

1. 10 week Psychic Development Package for you and 9 of your friends 

2. Book Club Package including a set of 10 books, journals and Oracle card decks

My story to Almost Fearless
At the age of 19, I stepped through a wall of fear in my life and became a small business owner. Little did I know, it would open up my life to fully exposing myself for who I am;  a leader, healer and psychic with a passion for creating safe and supportive space for others to learn and grow into their own gifts. 
I have found that no matter who we are, we are all bound together in a fear-based society. Each of us carries our own fears and many of us are conditioned to live in fear of being different or the fear of walking alone on our journey. 
Whether the journey involves psychic gifts or a fear of public speaking, none of us deserves to walk it alone. In A Life Lived Medium: A Psychic's Journey from Fearful to Almost Fearless I show my vulnerability so that others are inspired and encouraged to walk an almost fearless life by embracing their gifts and their differences as well. My goal is to lead by example by putting myself out there with this memoir. I stepped through my fear so that, hopefully, others will do the same.

The funding received from this campaign will be used to pay for the printing and marketing of my memoir. story:
OVA KNJIGA JE POTREBNA PROFESIONALCIMA

Knjiga „Tjelohranitelj – specijalist zaštite štićenih osoba“, obogatila je prostor regije sa stručnom literaturom u području sigurnosti i zaštite sa posebnim naglaskom na zaštitu štićenih / VIP osoba. 

Došao je trenutak da knjigu učinim dostupnom cijelom svijetu jer su upiti počeli stizati sa svih strana svijeta. Da bih to mogao napraviti potrebno je knjigu prevesti na engleski jezik.

Vjerujte mi to je zahtjevno i iziskuje puno vremena i novca. Da bi to bilo napravljeno na najbolji način angažirao sam prevoditelja koji će to napraviti profesionalna kao što je i knjiga namijenjena pravim profesionalcima.

Za to trebam pomoć svih vas koji uviđate važnost i potrebu da se poslovim zaštite osoba provode na najvišoj razini profeisonalnosti i stručnosti.

KOLIKO TO KOŠTA?

Kinjigu na hrvatskom jeziku sam u potpunosti sam financirao. To je bio moj životni projekt i dio životne misije.

Izdavanje i objava knjge je skupo. U knjizi se nalazi niz fotografija iz osobnog albuma ali i onih za koje sam trebao platiti naknadu agenciji da bi ih mogao objaviti. To sam učinio zato da knjiga bude na onoj razini koju i zaslužuje.

Prijevod knjige košta 25.000,00 kn neto.

Planirano je da knjiga na engleskom bude izdana krajem 2019. godine.

Osim ovih troškova tu će još biti i troškovi uređenja web stranice te promocije same knjige. Računam da će iznos od 5.000 EUR biti dovoljan da knjiga na engleskom jeziku ugleda svijetlo dana.

Svakako će to i biti jer to je cilj koji sam si zadao. Takve ciljeve ostvarujem. To se vidi jer sam i knigu na hrvatskom jeziku izdao kao jedna od sebi zadanih životnih ciljeva.

Ukoliko mi pomognete u tom cilju biti ću vam zahvalan.

UTJECAJ KNJIGE NA POSLOVE BLISKE ZAŠTITE

O važnosti knjige sam puno rekao u uvodnom videu. 

Poslovi bliske zaštite osoba su poslovi koji traže opsežno znanje iz područja sigurnosti kao i specifična znanja i vještine od važnosti za neposrednu zaštitu. Ovo je knjiga koja daje takva osnovna znanja. Ovom knjigom se direktno utjeće na podizanje standarda na poslovima blicke zaštite. 

O AUTORU

KRISTIAN DRUŽETA

Rođen je u Puli, 1971. godine. Otac je troje djece, Dominika, Nike i Ivana.
Vojni rok je služio u JNA. Krajem 1991. godine pristupio je Hrvatskoj vojsci. Na osobni zahtjev umirovljen je u činu narednika 2013. godine. Za vrijeme pričuvne i djelatne službe radio je poslove vojnika i dočasnika te obnašao časničke dužnosti.

Tri puta je bio u međunarodnoj vojnoj misiji u Afganistanu gdje je provodio poslove vojne policije sa naglaskom na poslove zaštite štićenih osoba i kao instruktor / mentor lokalnim snagama sigurnosti.

U vojnoj policiji je bio raspoređen u postrojbu za zaštitu VIP osoba kao pratitelj te kao instruktor u specijalnoj vojnoj policiji. Pored ovih poslova, u više od dvadeset godina djelatne vojne službe obnašao je poslove iz sigurnosno – obavještajnog i protokolarnog područja. Za svoj rad primio je niz pohvala i nagrada sa najviših razina zapovijedanja u oružanim snagama.

Diplomirao je 2011. godine na Kineziološkom fakultetu u Zagrebu i stekao stručni naziv „Stručni specijalist trenerske struke“. Prije toga je diplomirao na višoj trenerskoj na Kineziološkom fakultetu i stekao stručni naziv „Viši trener fizičke pripreme sportaša“. Na Fakultetu političkih znanosti završio je edukaciju za „Menadžera sigurnosti“ i postao je certificirani menadžer sigurnosti.

Pored ovih formalnih izobrazbi ima završen niz tečajeva iz sigurnosti sa naglaskom na područje zaštite VIP / štićenih osoba, protupobunjeničke borbe (COIN), protuterorističkih mjera prijetnji i napada improviziranim eksplozivnim napravama (C-IED), bliske borbe te drugih tečajeva iz područja sigurnosti.

Instruktor je samoobrane i specijalist za razvoj borbenog mentaliteta i mentalnog kondicioniranja prema Izraelskom sustavu Krav Maga.

Nacionalni je direktor i predstavnik IKMF - Internacionalne Krav Maga Federacije za Republiku Hrvatsku te provodi specijalizirane programe samoobrane, osobne zaštite, konfliktne komuniukacije i zaštite VIP i štićenih osoba.

story:
Short Summary

We lose one person every 40 seconds to suicide and another 20 attempts happen in that same time. Mental health has never been more important.

Hi, I'm Adam Stevens and I work as an educator in Australia in a high school. I see and experience first hand the devastation of adverse mental health, depression and anxiety in the students I work with daily. When I was just 12 my mother tried to take her own life. This impacted our family massively. After several other failed attempts my Mother took her own life at 56 years of age, after years of battling mental health issues and depression. Four years ago I came up with the idea for the book and I have recently completed it. Together with your support I hope to publish Catchers and further reduce the stigma around depression and mental health and help those who are in desperate need of guidance. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The budget of $35,000 will allow the publishing of 20,000 copies and the promotion of the book through a well designed book launch and social media campaign.

We are excited to offer all of our contributors a copy of the very first edition as well as the ability to contribute to the promotion of this very important message through becoming a distributor and or attending the launch in December. 

After reaching the campaigns target we will deliver a powerful message through 20,000 hard copies, an audio book, listing on Amazon, and a powerful social media campaign. Help us to reduce the number of needless losses to suicide.

The Impact

Suicides and suicide attempts have a ripple effect that impacts on families, friends, colleagues, communities and societies. Suicides are preventable. Much can be done to prevent suicide at individual, community and national levels. I am a regular contributor in the Education sector on engagement and well being of youth and his book is very much a culmination of my experience, knowledge and deep seeded desire to improve peoples mental health.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book and completing my promise of mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order level.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with our printers to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as Catchers hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of Catchers that you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but love the idea please contact us with your offer of help:

  • You can help by just sharing this campaign and spreading the message and making some noise about our campaign.
  •  Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thankyou for your time.

Adam Stevens - Author - "Catchers"

story:
The founding members of Kwest On Media met while working at different projects of Pacific News Service in the 1990s and 2000s. Pacific News Service was a non-profit media organization, with projects focused on developing young journalists, promoting ethnic media,  publishing the work of incarcerated people, young people in foster care, homeless youth, and academics and public intellectuals whose perspectives were absent from the discourse. It was our breeding ground, the place where we developed our news brains, learned to approach stories from unique perspectives and learned from each other. We also formed life-long friendships with our colleagues, continuing to collaborate professionally long after we left the News Service. 

 

 

In 2017,  Pacific News Service, then known as New America Media, announced that it was closing its doors. It was a sad day for those of us who came of age in the organization and passed through the office at crucial stages in our lives. Kwest On Media Editor In Chief Russell Morse came to Pacific News Service when he was incarcerated at San Francisco’s juvenile hall and soon saw his writing in national publications. Our Managing Editor, Eming Piansay, came to Pacific News Service as a high school student and went on to become an editor of the monthly magazine Youth Outlook. Every founding member of Kwest On found a home at Pacific News Service and enjoyed meaningful success in the world of journalism. 

The day we learned of Pacific News Service’s closing, Kwest On Media’s Tech Editor Tom Turpel posted on facebook, jokingly saying that the alumni of the organization should start our own media project. The response was overwhelming. One by one, alumni members chimed in on the thread saying that were on board. It quickly went from an offhand remark to a foundational moment.
 


From the start, our mission at Kwest On Media was to continue the work of Pacific News Service: to amplify the voices of marginalized people, to encourage people affected by the news of the day to tell their own stories, and to approach the news with a revolutionary/contrarian spirit. But we didn’t want to re-create Pacific News Service. We wanted to make something new and pursue stories and perspectives no one had ever seen in mainstream media before. We used the tools of 21st Century media—podcasting, video, social media—to more effectively spread our content and reach new audiences. Within weeks of Kwest On Media's founding, we had a manifesto, a staff, and a few chaotic episodes of a new podcast. 


 
To our surprise, our podcast has become our main point of contact with our followers. It started as a google hangout video chat editorial meeting where we discussed the news of the day, teased each other, pitched story ideas, challenged each other, and pursued all tangents. We chose to call the podcast Margin Call, a nod to our mission to highlight the experiences of marginalized people. Since then, we have recorded a podcast every week (over 60 to date) on subjects ranging from queer masculinity to Filipino history. Our guests have included San Francisco taxi drivers, a rapper from St. Petersburg, Florida, a trans rights activist, a New York City medical examiner who investigates fatal drug overdoses, a young Muslim woman working at a tech startup, and an American expatriate working at a factory in Germany. Margin Call has become our flagship media product and reaches hundreds of people all over the world. It’s available for streaming on iTunes, Spotify, and iHeartRadio. 

 
But we do a lot more than a weekly podcast. We publish one written piece a week on subjects as varied as how Xanax became the drug of choice for young rappers and why female superheroes are important. News on the site is organized into verticals: Technocracy, for tech news, Cell Migration, where we cover issues related to criminal justice, Ricanstruction, a series about Puerto Rico’s recovery from Hurricane Maria, Brokenomics, originally titled “the rent is too damn high,” where we publish economic stories with a focus on being young and broke, Entertain Us, our pop culture section, and Borderless, our immigration vertical.

Kwest On Media is a global venture. We have an Editor at Large in Mexico City, who covers immigration, a correspondent in Germany, and contributors throughout the United States, from California to Florida. Many of us are natives of the San Francisco Bay Area, so much of our coverage and our readership is focused on news in this region and we pay special attention to stories developing there that have national interest. We’re able to maintain contact with our global contributors using all the tech tools at our disposal: our contributor in Germany sends writing through WhatsApp, our podcast is recorded remotely, with guests joining from places all over the world, and our social media accounts and web site are updated at all hours of the night. 

For the past year, the mission of Kwest On Media has been a labor of love. We pay our expenses out of pocket and donate our time when we’re not at our day jobs. We’ve used this time to create a strategy for reaching our intended audience, developing our readership, looking into revenue streams, and developing innovative campaigns to make journalism great again. We believe we have cracked the code. 


In the past three years, journalism in America has been having something of a renaissance. A deeply troubling presidential administration and the proliferation of fake news on the internet have reminded people that journalism matters. We need responsible people working in media to uncover corruption, speak truth to power, and report the stories that have an immediate impact in our lives. We plan to use this renaissance to our advantage: positioning ourselves as an alternative to the partisan cable news noise machine. 
 
In response to the dizzying style of twitter journalism of constantly breaking news, we have pioneered the “slow news” movement: an effort to stay with a story, report on it thoroughly, and continue to check in on stories that matter long after they have left the news cycle and disappeared from our collective consciousness. 
 


Our Indiegogo campaign is an attempt to amplify our efforts. We have a detailed business plan in development for long term revenue generation, but we need to keep making content and fleshing out the site in order to make that work. So we are turning to our friends, family, followers, supporters, readers, and people everywhere who believe in the power of good journalism. Our goal is modest: we need enough money to pay for production, pay our contributors, and hire key team members who can help us create strong, consistent content and implement our business plan. If we reach our goal, we will be able to continue our mission and take it to the next level. 
Our goal is to become a prominent voice in the media market, amplifying voices of marginalized people and offering thoughtful perspectives on the news of the day from surprising perspectives. JOIN US!

Risks and challenges

The risk of any crowdfunding campaign is that the fundraisers will not reach their goal. In order to prevent that kind of setback, we were intentional about the amount that we requested. We created spreadsheets with the names of potential donors, reached out to people where we could, and made an estimate of the donations we could expect from our pool of potential donors. We took that amount and compared it to various budgets. We made a dream budget, including modest salaries for our staff members, audio and video equipment, and a large contributors budget. Then we made a much more modest budget, including only the fees we are currently paying out of pocket for operating expenses (podcast software licensing fees, web hosting, etc.). We found that the most modest budget was less than our conservative estimate of what we expected to raise and then added some more basic expenses: a stipend fund for youth journalism fellowships and compensation for our core staff members. Once those numbers matched up, we took it down a little to be sure that we were erring on the side of caution. We are confident that we can raise this amount with the support of our friends, family members, readers, viewers, supporters, and listeners. 

Once we raise the money, the risks and challenges are myriad. Media companies all over the world are still trying to find strategies to make journalism profitable. Our business plan for sustainability includes a combination of subscription rates and foundation money. By keeping our costs low and growing at a reasonable rate, we believe we have found a model that works. People are willing to pay for news that sets itself apart from the legions of corporate media companies and the assaultive news cycle. With thoughtful analysis and diverse voices, we believe we are creating a product that appeals to a specific consumer of news who is willing to pay for something different.
story_txt: The founding members of Kwest On Media met while working at different projects of Pacific News Service in the 1990s and 2000s. Pacific News Service was a non-profit media organization, with projects focused on developing young journalists, promoting ethnic media,  publishing the work of incarcerated people, young people in foster care, homeless youth, and academics and public intellectuals whose perspectives were absent from the discourse. It was our breeding ground, the place where we developed our news brains, learned to approach stories from unique perspectives and learned from each other. We also formed life-long friendships with our colleagues, continuing to collaborate professionally long after we left the News Service.   In 2017,  Pacific News Service, then known as New America Media, announced that it was closing its doors. It was a sad day for those of us who came of age in the organization and passed through the office at crucial stages in our lives. Kwest On Media Editor In Chief Russell Morse came to Pacific News Service when he was incarcerated at San Francisco’s juvenile hall and soon saw his writing in national publications. Our Managing Editor, Eming Piansay, came to Pacific News Service as a high school student and went on to become an editor of the monthly magazine Youth Outlook. Every founding member of Kwest On found a home at Pacific News Service and enjoyed meaningful success in the world of journalism. The day we learned of Pacific News Service’s closing, Kwest On Media’s Tech Editor Tom Turpel posted on facebook, jokingly saying that the alumni of the organization should start our own media project. The response was overwhelming. One by one, alumni members chimed in on the thread saying that were on board. It quickly went from an offhand remark to a foundational moment. From the start, our mission at Kwest On Media was to continue the work of Pacific News Service: to amplify the voices of marginalized people, to encourage people affected by the news of the day to tell their own stories, and to approach the news with a revolutionary/contrarian spirit. But we didn’t want to re-create Pacific News Service. We wanted to make something new and pursue stories and perspectives no one had ever seen in mainstream media before. We used the tools of 21st Century media—podcasting, video, social media—to more effectively spread our content and reach new audiences. Within weeks of Kwest On Media's founding, we had a manifesto, a staff, and a few chaotic episodes of a new podcast.  To our surprise, our podcast has become our main point of contact with our followers. It started as a google hangout video chat editorial meeting where we discussed the news of the day, teased each other, pitched story ideas, challenged each other, and pursued all tangents. We chose to call the podcast Margin Call, a nod to our mission to highlight the experiences of marginalized people. Since then, we have recorded a podcast every week (over 60 to date) on subjects ranging from queer masculinity to Filipino history. Our guests have included San Francisco taxi drivers, a rapper from St. Petersburg, Florida, a trans rights activist, a New York City medical examiner who investigates fatal drug overdoses, a young Muslim woman working at a tech startup, and an American expatriate working at a factory in Germany. Margin Call has become our flagship media product and reaches hundreds of people all over the world. It’s available for streaming on iTunes, Spotify, and iHeartRadio.  But we do a lot more than a weekly podcast. We publish one written piece a week on subjects as varied as how Xanax became the drug of choice for young rappers and why female superheroes are important. News on the site is organized into verticals: Technocracy, for tech news, Cell Migration, where we cover issues related to criminal justice, Ricanstruction, a series about Puerto Rico’s recovery from Hurricane Maria, Brokenomics, originally titled “the rent is too damn high,” where we publish economic stories with a focus on being young and broke, Entertain Us, our pop culture section, and Borderless, our immigration vertical.Kwest On Media is a global venture. We have an Editor at Large in Mexico City, who covers immigration, a correspondent in Germany, and contributors throughout the United States, from California to Florida. Many of us are natives of the San Francisco Bay Area, so much of our coverage and our readership is focused on news in this region and we pay special attention to stories developing there that have national interest. We’re able to maintain contact with our global contributors using all the tech tools at our disposal: our contributor in Germany sends writing through WhatsApp, our podcast is recorded remotely, with guests joining from places all over the world, and our social media accounts and web site are updated at all hours of the night. For the past year, the mission of Kwest On Media has been a labor of love. We pay our expenses out of pocket and donate our time when we’re not at our day jobs. We’ve used this time to create a strategy for reaching our intended audience, developing our readership, looking into revenue streams, and developing innovative campaigns to make journalism great again. We believe we have cracked the code. In the past three years, journalism in America has been having something of a renaissance. A deeply troubling presidential administration and the proliferation of fake news on the internet have reminded people that journalism matters. We need responsible people working in media to uncover corruption, speak truth to power, and report the stories that have an immediate impact in our lives. We plan to use this renaissance to our advantage: positioning ourselves as an alternative to the partisan cable news noise machine.  In response to the dizzying style of twitter journalism of constantly breaking news, we have pioneered the “slow news” movement: an effort to stay with a story, report on it thoroughly, and continue to check in on stories that matter long after they have left the news cycle and disappeared from our collective consciousness.  Our Indiegogo campaign is an attempt to amplify our efforts. We have a detailed business plan in development for long term revenue generation, but we need to keep making content and fleshing out the site in order to make that work. So we are turning to our friends, family, followers, supporters, readers, and people everywhere who believe in the power of good journalism. Our goal is modest: we need enough money to pay for production, pay our contributors, and hire key team members who can help us create strong, consistent content and implement our business plan. If we reach our goal, we will be able to continue our mission and take it to the next level. Our goal is to become a prominent voice in the media market, amplifying voices of marginalized people and offering thoughtful perspectives on the news of the day from surprising perspectives. story:
“CYC" from Me to You:

Looking for a mindset book & fresh perception of your own life?

Would like to improve your daily life qualities and so on?

This book is for you.

 

 

Craft Your Counterpart represents pure brilliance & simplicity of your energy & laws of the universe. This book contains everything that has helped me & many more to improve & grow in life. Starting from mental preparation & going down to actual physical practices. More for practical use, rather than just wish-full thinking.

It works for me, as well as many more well-known individuals. It will work for you.

It is designed to be a simple, enjoyable and energizing read which must be put into practice.
This book is an asset of information & knowledge. It is the support you wish you would have had a long time ago to make your desires a reality.

 

It is Based on True Story:
A few years ago I got inspired to create while sitting on a central park bench with my best friend in New York City. 
Took me a few years to go through the process, struggle & see what works from what I was learning/practicing & what doesn’t.

I had to experiment & test it on myself. I did it & I am still doing it! 

It’s healthy, so I just carry on & progress shows.

I fell in love with energy & mind subject & it became a part of my daily life.

Awesome experiences throughout the years & the finest creation of CYC is one of the many approvals that this all concept of energy & mind works.

I am proud of my work & this book.

When you use it, this material is priceless on the scale of what it can do for you.

It has a simple way of delivering the necessary information to set you up for the process of success.

 

Book Breakdown

Chapters that have been lived before they were written.

Fresh perception & mindset manual...

 

Creative approach

This Book will serve You as Mental Passport - More you use it, more places you will go first mentally & later physically...

 

Exclusive wall art straight out of the book


Some of the pages contain the inspirational graphics what we decided to create as wall art to look up to and remind you of your goals in life.

 

Meet the author/CRAFTER perk.

New York a place where the magic happens. We will meet in NYC & have a 3-4 "full-on" performance days together & we will walk the streets to see where it all started. Most importantly, we will start to write your new story. This is going to be that “Life-changing trip” that you have always wanted.

Perception changing, quality time together & Exclusive CYC story at the dinner table.

Together we will create a custom map for you to use and we will discuss how to achieve your goals in a most suitable & effective way.

Deep insights on all three subjects - Spiritual, Mental & Physical & how to apply them in your daily life, creating a perfect life balance.

After Trip - 30 Days daily support & collaboration on fresh perception, motivation & habit creation.

Whatever the desire of yours is- we will make it work.

Of course, you will receive a Book Gift Pack & other goodies.

 

Project In Project:

CYC is a stepping stone of an expanding concept that I call “Crafting.” 

Crafting is a Spiritual, Mental & Physical self - preparation & life balance creation in your own life.
I love working with energy & mind, to simply turn desires into real-life experiences. That is what this is all about.

Find out more - www.Karlisvilb.com

I found my pitch, I wrote a book, I left behind disturbing habits & addictions. It enabled me to discover motivation and drive in all aspects of my life. 

Now I am in my own lane of what I call & define as “progress & success.” 

This book will put you there too.

Don’t miss out on"Craft Your Counterpart”

 

Your Support & Crafting starts here:

Support the CYC Project on pre-sale by picking a perk & ordering a book.

The goal is to print 500 books on the first drop:

Each one of these copies will be printed on the finest papers & materials. Handled & posted to you by myself & my team with positive vibes all over the world, 3-4 weeks after the campaign closes. 

By backing you are supporting - Start of something great, CYC creation future, handling & posting, marketing & general expansion. 

Also, my Youtube Vlog series is going live soon, so feel free to subscribe - http://bit.do/KarlisVilbers 

You're Awesome &  Thank You for the support :)

story:
I am a designer, a creative mind, and a sensitive soul. I am the Digital Design Director at The Guardian, I have worked as a teacher at Shillington College for two years, teaching on the part time course. I have a passion for design, design education, and mental health. I am the author of this little book. It’s a very important topic to me, and it’s one I think that as an industry we don’t talk about enough. Not to mention that I have myself suffered from a variety of things with my mental health - and I think it's time that we talk about it. 

By supporting this campaign and donating towards the production of the book, you will, by proxy be supporting young creatives, who like me might have suffered with mental health, anxiety and depression which can manifest itself in many ways. 

This is somewhat my story - and told through the lens that I know, graphic design, but i hope this will be a useful tool for many creatives and people who are interested in mental health. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this project I need around £3000 as an initial investment into printing and producing a book which I will send out some to Universities, and schools, and sell the majority - of which any of the profit will be give to mental health charities.

£20 Donation
Get a copy of the book a personal letter of thanks from yours truly! 

£50 Donation 
Get 2 copies of the book and a personal letter of thanks from yours truly! 

£100 Donation
Get 2 copies of the book and a personal letter of thanks from yours truly! 
3 x Illustrated face posters 
A dedication to you will be made in the book.
Invitation to the book launch (London location TBC).

£200 - £500 Donation
Get 5 copies of the book and a personal letter of thanks from yours truly! 
3 x Illustrated face posters 
A dedication to you will be made in the book.
Invitation to the book launch (London location TBC).
Meet up! For anyone who would like and donates between £200 - £500 I will arrange to come and deliver you books and we can chat, have coffee, lunch all on me! 

Educational / Charity / Organisational Partner
If you would like to be an Educational or Charity partner - please send me an email and we can chat about how you might be able to help, and how I can help you. I would like to extend the book to talking at Universities so if you would be interested in this, drop me a line:

hello@benlongdendesign.co.uk

The Story

This book is a collection of experiences about creativity and mental health. The book takes the focus of graphic design as I have been practicing as a designer for nearly 15 years, it felt right to write it from my personal perspective. I wanted to collect together my thoughts around mental health for a couple of reasons. I am a designer who has suffered or at least struggled with mental health issues over the past few years. I think it’s important to share with the design community, and open this up to people who might like me sometimes struggle. 

I believe that as a creative person there is an intrinsic link between the mind, the health of the mind and being creative. I think that within our industry we need to be aware of this link, and take care of our mental health no matter what profession, as this will inevitably lead people to feeling more creative, and be able to sustain that creative drive and enthusiasm for what they do. 

In the 60 pages contained within this humble little publication I have collected together my thoughts, and experiences of graduating from university, working as a junior, working with clients, exceptions and pressure, all the way to working as Digital Design Director at The Guardian. All in all, I hope that people find something useful enclosed within these pages.

Who

This book has been produced because I believe it to be a useful companion to students, junior designers, aspiring designer, or anyone who is like me a creative mind, that is often frustrated, sometimes anxious, but always looking to better themselves in solving problems, challenges and doing great work. 

Beyond that I see this book as a valuable tool for creative people to think more mindfully about their practice, and hopefully will be a comfort for those who are feeling they can’t, even though they can. Those people can feel in good company with other designers who feel just the same. 

Thank you!

story:
One of the most misunderstood and most important bands in the history of music is Black Sabbath. To the uninitiated, their music is loud, annoying, Satan-worshipping nonsense. To those who get it, Black Sabbath provided a soundtrack, not only for the disenfranchised of the '70s and dreamers of the '80s, but for pure music lovers...those who wanted more from their music.  

BLACK SABBATH: THE VINYL TESTAMENT is a deep dive into the history of the band, from their first album until THE END! Every album is picked apart, the stories leading into it are told, and each song is reviewed. Written by music journalist/historian/podcaster Matt "Matman" Herring,  THE VINYL TESTAMENT is an intimate look into a half-century of bone-crushing riffs, thought-provoking lyrics, a band that had to fight for, and are still fighting for, every bit of respect they deserve. 

 

Like his previous music books, UFO: YOUR FAVORITE BAND'S FAVORITE BAND and ASIA: TIME AND TIME AGAIN, Herring has shared his thoughts about another band that means so much to him. “When I write about a band, I am completely honest. If I don’t like something, I will say it. But I will always preface my remarks by reminding the reader that this is my opinion and it doesn’t make the band or its music bad.” As a lover of history, Herring writes his books as history lessons about his favorite bands, telling a story that instills or rekindles a love for his subjects.

     

"One of the big things I learned from writing this book was how Black Sabbath never had the support they needed from their management and record labels. Instead of protecting them, the band was mistreated and manipulated. They were kept on the road or in the studio and high enough to not ask the questions they should have been asking."

The book also explores its members pre- and post-Black Sabbath careers, including the story of Jimi Bell, currently the guitarist for Autograph and House Of Lords. In 1987, Bell auditioned to play in Ozzy Osbourne's band, and made into the top two during the audition process. He would later join the Geezer Butler Band until that project fell apart.

 

BLACK SABBATH: THE VINYL TESTAMENT is a full-color, 200+ page book that features an incredible cover by Andrew Edge, which cleverly pays homage to The Beatles for a reason that is explained in the book, and is a band that both Black Sabbath and Herring love. Inside are awesome pictures taken by fans at concerts and meet-and-greets, as well as rarities from fans' collections, including posters, bootlegs, autographed albums, and CDs.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $1,000 in order to print, promote, and ship this passion project. We will use the money to print the book, draw industry attention, and ship the incentives to campaign supporters. To thank you all for your help, we've assembled an awesome collection of incentives ranging from postcards to premium hardcover copies of the book, personalized for each supporter by the author. The incentives are set at price points from $5.00 to $100, so there's something for everyone.

Stretch Goals

We're shooting for $1,000 - but we know what to do when we raise more. More money equals more promotion equals more impact...so...when we hit the goal of $1,000.00 everyone will receive an amazing PDF portrait of Tony Iommi by Rusty Gilligan. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the art as well as the PDF.

When we hit $1,500.00 we will unlock our second stretch goal incentive...an amazing PDF "Ozzy-era" illustration by Andrew Edge. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the artwork as well as the PDF.

When we hit $2,000.00 we will unlock our third stretch goal incentive...an amazing PDF "Dio-era" illustration by Andrew Edge. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the artwork as well as the PDF.

Risks & Challenges

Nothing is without known (and unforeseen) challenges, but the book and incentives are ready to print and the recordings are recorded. We've done this a time or two so barring the zombie apocalypse we're pretty confident in our ability to get your incentives out in a timely fashion.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute right now, but if you want to help get the word out by sharing campaign updates on social media it would be really appreciated. There are some convenient sharing tools right here on Indiegogo to make it easy, so thank you for whatever you can do.

Inside are awesome pictures taken by fans at concerts and meet-and-greets, as well as rarities from fans' collections, including posters, bootlegs, autographed albums, and CDs.

What We Need & What You Get
We're looking to raise $1,000 in order to print, promote, and ship this passion project. We will use the money to print the book, draw industry attention, and ship the incentives to campaign supporters. To thank you all for your help, we've assembled an awesome collection of incentives ranging from postcards to premium hardcover copies of the book, personalized for each supporter by the author. The incentives are set at price points from $5.00 to $100, so there's something for everyone.

Stretch Goals
We're shooting for $1,000 - but we know what to do when we raise more. More money equals more promotion equals more impact...so...when we hit the goal of $1,000.00 everyone will receive an amazing PDF portrait of Tony Iommi by Rusty Gilligan. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the art as well as the PDF.

When we hit $1,500.00 we will unlock our second stretch goal incentive...an amazing PDF "Ozzy-era" illustration by Andrew Edge. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the artwork as well as the PDF.

When we hit $2,000.00 we will unlock our third stretch goal incentive...an amazing PDF "Dio-era" illustration by Andrew Edge. Everyone at the $30 level and above will receive an exclusive print of the artwork as well as the PDF.


Risks & Challenges
Nothing is without known (and unforeseen) challenges, but the book and incentives are ready to print and the recordings are recorded. We've done this a time or two so barring the zombie apocalypse we're pretty confident in our ability to get your incentives out in a timely fashion.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you can't contribute right now, but if you want to help get the word out by sharing campaign updates on social media it would be really appreciated. There are some convenient sharing tools right here on Indiegogo to make it easy, so thank you for whatever you can do.

story:
Short description

My name is Mikhail Kozlovsky, and I am a professor in Chemistry. Born in Ukraine and raised in Moscow, Russia, now I live in Germany. But for all those years, I had a parallel "second life" full of crazy events, escapades, informal communities, etc. And, surely, a lot of sex.
Recently I've completed a manuscript in Russian titled "Memoirs of a Moscow Casanova". In 15 novels followed by a short roman I use true stories of my life, to paint in full colour the last years of the USSR and the times of "perestroika" afterwards. Disintegration and fall of the socialistic "belle époque". As viewed through a magic mirror of sex, since "In the USSR there is no such thing as sex".

And now I am looking for financial support to finalize and publish these memoirs as a book.

What you give & what you get

Nowadays, a printed book is not a source of information but rather a luxury - exactly as my life is described in the "Memoirs". So it is worth a high end publication: with a hard cover and illustrated with exclusive paintings created by a professional artist - Elena Rabinovich (Mainz, Germany).

And every donator will get such a luxury himself!

Please note that, besides the publication costs for 200 copies, some part of the raised funding will be paid to the artist. But not any profit or royalties.

As a result

I strongly hope that the "Memoirs of a Moscow Casanova" will become a significant monument to the bygone decades, similar to the original "Story of my life" by Giacomo Casanova or, e.g., "Intimate diaries" by Anaïs Nin.

It should also be mentioned here that I've already finished successfully several projects including two collections of poetry along with a fantasy roman which got a considerable positive response in the Web.

    Risks and Problems

    The only risk for the applied project is that nobody would be interested. In this instance, however, I will join a nice company including Giacomo Casanova himself. Since his memoires fell into oblivion for decades, before having been rediscovered and coming to the top of popularity.

    An active and efficient advertising campaign can help to overcome that obstacle, nevertheless.

      Other ways to help

      Any contacts to possible translators of my memoirs into English would be also very useful for success of my project.

      And, surely, please do not hesitate to spread rumours about my project all over Your community.

story:
My name is Brandon Ferdig. I'm a writer who spent most of 2014 volunteering at a village school in Tanzania, East Africa. Now I'm back in Minnesota, and I'm planning a speaking tour to share my experiences with those who have been reading about them over the past year

***

It all started two years ago. I was seeking an opportunity to live abroad when I met a Tanzanian man who needed someone to help start his village school's computer classes.

After raising money and buying 10 laptops, I flew out to Tanzania to put them to use. And on January 25, 2014, I arrived at the village Magulilwa and the school, Magulilwa Area Secondary School.

I stayed in a small room at the school. No plumbing. No regular electricity. I ate what they ate. I lived on campus as did the other teachers and students.

And I taught computers for eight months.

This was just the start of my experiences...

In the village, I would become their portrait photographer.

I would leave the village and travel to every corner of Tanzania, as well as to other countries in the region.

Most important, I explored and documented the ways of life I saw each step of the way.

Politics:

Commerce:

Religion:

Law and Justice:

Daily living:

Recreation:

Health care:

To this day, I write about these experiences on my blog, The Periphery. 

This blog is featured on newspaper websites across the upper Midwest. It is for these audiences that I will present my stories and the lessons they offer--about them, about us, about life. I'll do so by way of a multimedia presentation: word, photograph, and footage to recreate the highlights of my nine months in Africa.

In addition, I'll share my newly-released book (and multimedia eBook) Life Learned Abroad: Lessons on Humanity from China, a chronology of observations, experiences, stories, and insights gained from my previous travel: a year in China.

To promote the tour, I've teamed up with media company Forum Communications--parent company to the newspapers who feature my writing. This six-stop series will have me share Africa (and China) to audiences in Fargo, Grand Forks, Bemidji, Duluth, Brainerd, and the Twin Cities. 

**

So I've got the audiences. I've got the promotion. What I need is some gas money (and food money and motel money...)

My goal is $1600 for travel and event expenses. It breaks down like this:

Personal

$95 for gas for 842 miles

$330 for five nights' lodging (I can stay with family in Bemidji and my own place in the Twin Cities.)

$175 for meals

Total = $600

Event

$475 for refreshments/hors d'oeuvres

$150 for space rental (most locations' rent is covered)

$175 audio/visual equipment fees

Total = $800

Miscellaneous

$200 for Emergency Fund 

Total = $200

Grand total = $1600 ($20 from 80 people) 

Overage: If I'm fortunate enough to raise funds above and beyond, I'll put it toward this camera. This was the very model that survived nine months in East Africa and provided the shots you see above. Unfortunately, it didn't make it through a spill on a four-wheeler in the woods of northern Minnesota three weeks after returning home. 

What do you get for helping me out?  Well, in addition to warm fuzzies and good karma, see the perks listed to the right. 

BUT, YOU DON'T HAVE TO GIVE ANYTHING TO FOLLOW ALONG THE TOUR. I'll be updating on Twitter @brandonferdig and Facebook with #LifeLearnedAbroad. 

***

This tour was a brainstorm I hoped to make happen after my China travels. I'm excited to be able to see it come together after this latest exploration through East Africa.

The action starts March 27 in Fargo and ends April 4 in the Twin Cities. I hope you can be a part of helping me share the lessons of Life Learned Abroad.
